story:
UPDATE:

New Version 2.2:
Available at www.propella.bike

 

 

Propella is an electric pedal-assist bicycle that is elegant, fun to ride, and easy to use. The 2nd generation of Propella combines high-quality components with the latest technology to create a lightweight electric bike that rides and feels like a traditional road bike.

Our 250W Bafang motor helps you glide up hills without exhausting yourself, and our portable, detachable and lockable 6.8Ah Panasonic battery pack gives you up to 35 miles of range. Simple, intuitive pedal assist controls mean riding a Propella 2.0 feels just like riding a standard road bike – only better.

 

 

 

 

 
 

 

 

             

 

Propella's mission is to bridge the gap between regular bikes and electric bikes (eBikes). We strive for simplicity, and our minimalist design allows us to achieve our goal by eliminating unnecessary features and focusing on essential elements.

"A great E-bike must be a great bike in the first place"

Propella avoids the excessive weight and cost of traditional eBikes. With just the right amount of power, Propella transforms a traditional road bicycle into an extraordinary electric vehicle.

           
 

 

At a remarkable weight of 34.5 lbs (15.6 kgs), the Propella 2.0 is classified as the lightest electric vehicle in its class.

Benefits of lightweight E-Bikes:

  • Easy to lift and carry
  • Shorter stopping distance
  • More efficient (longer range) 

 

 

 

Thanks to Panasonic's latest lithium-ion technology, the 2nd generation of Propella eBikes are equipped with an all-new compact and portable battery pack that uses high-capacity battery cells.  

  • Removable with anti-theft lock
  • 15 - 45 miles (24 - 56 km) of range
  • 2.5-hour charge time
  • Charged with standard wall outlet
  • Ultra-lightweight at 3.5 lbs (1.6 kgs)
 
 

 

 

A 250 watt geared hub motor is seamlessly integrated into the rear wheel hub and is the perfect solution for adding an extra boost to your ride.

Whether you’re commuting to work or just riding for fun, electric assist can help you reach your destination with ease. Bike farther, faster, and longer thanks to added electric power.

 
 
 

 

       

Choose your pedal assist (PAS) level from the LED display and enjoy the boost of electric power!  The higher the PAS level, the more power from the motor. Or simply select level "0" for a classic bicycle experience.

Pedal assist starts when you start pedaling and stops when you stop pedaling - simple as that!

 

A great electric bike must be a great bike in the first place. The 2nd generation of Propella boasts excellent ride quality due to a combination of proper weight distribution and quality bicycle components. 

 

 

       
 
We've discovered that a single-speed electric bike is quite capable of climbing most hills. A single-speed Propella is lightweight, sleek, and streamlined, and ranks very high in terms of reliability.
 
If you prefer having the flexibility of gears, you may consider choosing the multi-speed (7 speeds) option.
 
The multi-speed option is equipped with a  Shimano Altus 7-speed derailleur and shifter system at an extra cost of $250. The multi-speed option adds a bit of weight (about 1.5 lbs), more moving parts, and requires occasional maintenance just like any other bicycle with gears. However it provides the benefit of incline and long distance riding without the need for electric assist.
               
 
 
 

After being inspired by concept electric vehicles, we wanted to develop an electric bike that riders could be proud of.  We've put a lot of thought into the aesthetics of the design since day one so that Propella riders can be guaranteed to own the most beautiful electric bike in the world.

 

 

The Propella 2.0 frame is a blend of road bike and mountain bike to provide a one-size-fits-most geometry. The seat post can be adjusted to accommodate a rider's height.

 

 

 
 
 
 

 

Special thanks to Indiegogo and all the backers who helped make Propella Version 1.0 a reality and gave life to a revolutionary electric bike. We successfully developed the 1st generation of Propella eBikes and were honored to receive great feedback and media coverage.

Propella 1.0 campaign video (2016)
 

 

 

Steve Aoki riding his Propella

 

How can I contact Propella?

Please visit our website contact page.

Do you ship internationally?

Currently, we offer shipping to USA and CANADA for the September 2017 production run.

Sign up here to stay tuned on international shipping. 

Note: Backers outside of US are responsible for any local or import tax. Please check your country's import duties before purchasing. There is currently no import tax for the US, but it varies internationally. 

How much does shipping cost?

-USA ground shipping: $95

-Canada ground shipping: $150

Can the Propella eBike be used as a normal "non-electric" bicycle?

Yes. By turning off the pedal assist (PAS) on the LED display or turning off the battery, you can ride without any electric assist. 

The motor has zero rolling resistance which means it does not cause resistance when turned off.

What are the limits for rider height for this eBike?

With feedback from our last campaign, we’ve redesigned the frame geometry to expand the height as much as possible. Our one-size-fits-most frame is suitable for riders 5’-3” to 6’-2”. 

Please refer to the frame size chart for more information on height and fitting.

Depending on the number of pre-orders we receive we look forward to offering more frame sizes in the future.

Can I choose a different color?

Based on our survey from last year’s color options, blue was by far the most popular choice. At this point, Propella 2.0 will come with anodized blue rims only.

Can I charge the battery by pedaling?

Short answer, no. Charging by pedaling (regenerative charging) is only possible with direct-drive motors. Direct-drive motors are much larger, heavier, and consume more power than hub motors. 

Where can I demo this eBike?

One of the reasons we can offer such amazing product to you is through our consumer direct model.

Propella had demo days at the Seattle Bike Show in 2016 and 2017, and other events across the US. We will announce upcoming demo event details on our website, social media, and newsletter. Sign up here to stay informed!

Is there a throttle mode?

Propella eBikes are operated by pedal-assist only. Throttle on electric bikes faces regulation issues in many countries.

What kind of assembly is required?

All eBikes will be about 90% assembled and packaged in a standard bike box. The front wheel,  pedals, and handlebar require assembly. 

Although assembly may seem straightforward, we recommend professional assembly at a local bike shop in order to ensure safety, reliability, and comfort.

Is Propella waterproof?

All of the electric components, including the battery pack, are designed to be splash and rain proof. We will be testing all the electrical components per the International Protection Marking Code (IP Code). Once testing is complete, we will update backers on the IP code of each e-component.

Are rack and fenders compatible with this bike?

Yes, the frame and fork are designed with standard eyelets to accommodate racks, fenders, and other bicycle accessories.

Note: The single-speed version does not have a screw-hole on the drop-out. It is compatible with certain types of rear racks. We recommend you check with a bike shop to ensure compatibility before purchasing a rear fender.

Is the LCD control display detachable?

Yes, the display is detachable by removing a single screw underneath. Upon successful completion of this campaign, we hope to offer different kinds of LED displays on our website.

What kind of warranty do you offer?

Please see our warranty policy here.

How many times can I charge the battery?

The lithium-ion cells in the battery pack can be fully charged/discharged 500-600 times. Battery packs can last 1-4 years depending on the frequency of usage.

How do I recharge the battery pack?

The battery pack can be charged on or off the bike by plugging it into the battery charger. The battery charger plugs into a standard wall outlet.

Will the charger work with 120V and 220V outlets?

Yes, the battery charger accepts an input voltage of 120 - 220VAC.

Is there a water bottle mount?

Yes. The water bottle eyelets are placed on the underside of the down tube of the frame. 

Are the wheels detachable?

Yes. The front wheel comes off easily using a quick-release connection. The rear wheel is attached to the hub motor and can be detached by removing the screws with a standard wrench.

How do I replace my tires?

The front and rear tires are replaced the same way as a traditional bicycle. 

Can I get a refund?

Please refer to IndieGoGo's policy here.

Is the 2.0 battery backwards compatible with my Propella 1.0?

Unfortunately, no. Developing a smaller battery enclosure required us to design a new battery mount. The 1.0 battery will not fit in the 2.0 battery mount.

New Version 2.2:Available at www.propella.bike

 

 
Propella is an electric pedal-assist bicycle that is elegant, fun to ride, and easy to use. The 2nd generation of Propella combines high-quality components with the latest technology to create a lightweight electric bike that rides and feels like a traditional road bike.
Our 250W Bafang motor helps you glide up hills without exhausting yourself, and our portable, detachable and lockable 6.8Ah Panasonic battery pack gives you up to 35 miles of range. Simple, intuitive pedal assist controls mean riding a Propella 2.0 feels just like riding a standard road bike – only better.
 



 

 

 

 
 


               

 
Propella's mission is to bridge the gap between regular bikes and electric bikes (eBikes). We strive for simplicity, and our minimalist design allows us to achieve our goal by eliminating unnecessary features and focusing on essential elements.
"A great E-bike must be a great bike in the first place"
Propella avoids the excessive weight and cost of traditional eBikes. With just the right amount of power, Propella transforms a traditional road bicycle into an extraordinary electric vehicle.
             At a remarkable weight of 34.5 lbs (15.6 kgs), the Propella 2.0 is classified as the lightest electric vehicle in its class.Benefits of lightweight E-Bikes:
Easy to lift and carry
Shorter stopping distance
More efficient (longer range) 
   
Thanks to Panasonic's latest lithium-ion technology, the 2nd generation of Propella eBikes are equipped with an all-new compact and portable battery pack that uses high-capacity battery cells.  

Removable with anti-theft lock
15 - 45 miles (24 - 56 km) of range
2.5-hour charge time
Charged with standard wall outlet
Ultra-lightweight at 3.5 lbs (1.6 kgs)

    A 250 watt geared hub motor is seamlessly integrated into the rear wheel hub and is the perfect solution for adding an extra boost to your ride.Whether you’re commuting to work or just riding for fun, electric assist can help you reach your destination with ease. Bike farther, faster, and longer thanks to added electric power.    

       
Choose your pedal assist (PAS) level from the LED display and enjoy the boost of electric power!  The higher the PAS level, the more power from the motor. Or simply select level "0" for a classic bicycle experience.
Pedal assist starts when you start pedaling and stops when you stop pedaling - simple as that!
 

A great electric bike must be a great bike in the first place. The 2nd generation of Propella boasts excellent ride quality due to a combination of proper weight distribution and quality bicycle components.          
 We've discovered that a single-speed electric bike is quite capable of climbing most hills. A single-speed Propella is lightweight, sleek, and streamlined, and ranks very high in terms of reliability. If you prefer having the flexibility of gears, you may consider choosing the multi-speed (7 speeds) option. The multi-speed option is equipped with a  Shimano Altus 7-speed derailleur and shifter system at an extra cost of $250. The multi-speed option adds a bit of weight (about 1.5 lbs), more moving parts, and requires occasional maintenance just like any other bicycle with gears. However it provides the benefit of incline and long distance riding without the need for electric assist.               
   
After being inspired by concept electric vehicles, we wanted to develop an electric bike that riders could be proud of.  We've put a lot of thought into the aesthetics of the design since day one so that Propella riders can be guaranteed to own the most beautiful electric bike in the world.
  The Propella 2.0 frame is a blend of road bike and mountain bike to provide a one-size-fits-most geometry. The seat post can be adjusted to accommodate a rider's height.

       
Special thanks to Indiegogo and all the backers who helped make Propella Version 1.0 a reality and gave life to a revolutionary electric bike. We successfully developed the 1st generation of Propella eBikes and were honored to receive great feedback and media coverage.

Steve Aoki riding his Propella

story:
Turn any bike to an Electric Bike: 20", 24", 26", 700c, 29"

Summary

Wanting to quickly, easily and affordably convert my everyday bicycle to an electric bicycle. There was no solution to this dilemma. Everything on the market was expensive and required extensive installation and couldn't easily switch my bike back to a standard bicycle when not wanting electric power.

So I sent to out to bring the best solution to market. EZ Wheelie is a completely wireless electric bike conversion wheel. Turn any bike from a 20" kids bike to a 29" mountain to an ebike in one minute with our completely wireless solution. Best of all just as easily convert your bike back to a standard bike or put the wheel on another bike. 

Questions? Email: Hello@ezwheelie.com

Technology and Specifications

The truly wireless electric bike conversion wheel with smart app or optional wireless display.  No wires, no sensors to install, just install the wheel, download the app and GO!

  • All in one wheel, battery, motor, sensors, and computer all contained inside front wheel.
  • 250 Watt Geared Motor, IP65 waterproof.
  • Multiple battery size options, standard 36V 2.9AH (20 Mile Range), commuter 36V 5.8AH (40 Mile Range), 8.7AH (60 Mile Range).
  • Patented 6-Axis Gyroscope gives the most responsive and efficient electric bike ride. All controlled through the smartphone app.
  • 5 Levels of pedal assist up to 32km/h (20 mph).
  • Fits any standard bicycle. Available in 20", 24", 26", 700c, 29" in various rim widths and colors (white or black), with disc brake or rim brake. 

Quick and Easy Installation

Dedicated Smartphone App (ios and Android)

Optional Wireless Display

First Mass Production Run Started!

Top Review and Rating From Profta

What We Need & What You Get

The EZ Wheelie is ready for final production, tested and ready for our customers. We are running an Indiegogo campaign to fundraise the cost to complete production and get our product out to as many people as possible.

By backing the campaign you'll get a one time opportunity to get an EZ Wheelie for up to 50% off and be the first to own one! We guarantee delivery and offer a 30 day money back guarantee after delivery.

Timeline

  • Fall 2017: set out to create an easy affordable solution to electric bike conversion
  • January 2018: final concept of EZ Wheelie Completed
  • March 2018: first production ready prototype built and testing started
  • June 2018: successful pre Indiegogo campaign https://theszource.com/products/wireless-e-bike...
  • July 2018: Indiegogo Campaign Launched
  • August 2018: final first round production completed
  • October 2018: delivery to Indiegogo Backers

Say Goodbye to Messy, Complicated and Expensive Conversion Kits

Commute To Work Without Breaking a Sweat, Ride Farther Longer, Conquer the Hill You Avoid, and JUST HAVE FUN!

story:
www.project-maple.com

What is it?

SensePod is a collision avoidance system intended for motorcycles, but it can also be used for bicycles and scooters (you can affix it to anything with a non-porous surface). Its purpose is to detect cars within collision range of a motorcycle so that the user is able to make prompt decisions about the next action he or she should take in a crisis situation. This is not intended to replace your brain! You should always perform head checks when changing lanes! SensePod's purpose is to take a stab at identifying options. If a car pulls out 150ft in front of a motorcycle traveling 45 mph, in one second the motorcycle has traveled 66ft. On a multi-lane roadway, there are two options: brake, or change lanes. It takes 1 second on average to respond to any stimuli, another second to perform a head check... 132ft have now slipped by without any action taken. The SensePod will let the rider know if a vehicle is obstructing a lane next to them, letting them take the appropriate action of braking, changing lanes with a head check, or a combination of the two. It uses ultrasonic sensors, a PCB with Arduino code, a few wires, an EXTREMELY COOL 3D PRINTED HOUSING! such as this one-

and some code to detect vehicles in adjacent lanes. The rider is notified via the included LEDs which will be mounted inside the helmet. 

How does it work?

The ultrasonic sensors work by transmitting "pings" and receiving their echoes. The software calculates the distance to the object with a simple formula. Our proprietary software excludes bad data caused by wind interference leaving you with an ultrasonic sensor that works at speeds in excess of 75 mph! 

SensePod is mounted with suction cups to the back of the helmet or any non-porous surface. Keep in mind that these pictures are of the protoytpe. Things will change but only for the better!

SensePod attached to a helmet

 

Feel free to mount it anywhere, including directly to your bike

But are those suction cups strong?

Are they? Well yes, they sure are, but don't worry, we'll be supplying a "granny strap" just in case you drive really really fast!

A simple stereo audio connection provides easy removal of the system from the helmet so you can transfer it to another.

 

Just how reliable is it?

We have achieved a 95% effective efficiency as rough road conditions can sometimes cause false signals (like pot-holes).

The current prototype, which was used in the video, misses about one car out of 200- and that's if the speed differential is greater than 20 mph. 

Battery life from the current power supply is about 4 days working nonstop around the clock. These are generalizations as the final production model will feature many improvements.

Why do I need your support?

My father had a friend that lost his life due to a collision with an automobile. I would like to build this product and be able to provide anyone from around the world with a SensePod of their very own. It would be great if I could just snap my fingers and make this happen but I need your support.

I need things that my dreams can't provide such as:

  • space
  • 3D printers (these little things are going to revolutionize the world and product distribution)
  • revamping my current workshop
  • the ability to buy large quantities of ultrasonic sensors, PCBs and other components
  • expanding my company, Project Maple, to take on some very cool future endeavors

 That's simply not going to happen... unless... 

You contribute! There are multiple perks available for you to pick from and I hope I've created one that would cater to everyone interested in this project. Just check out the right hand side of this page and pick one.

 

The Impact

Your contribution to this business/ project right now is honestly the best of feelings. As I type this, I haven't recieved a single dollar, but I know, that through someone purchasing these, it would feel like raising a child. So thank you, seriously.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share! 

Some more pictures

 

T-shirt

 

To everyone of Indiegogo...

Whether this project is successful or if fails entirely, I want to preemptively provide the utmost gratitude to everyone in the community. For without this, my project would have never left the helmet I attached it to. There are some truly great things happening here. The world is changing and we have front row seats...

 

About me

I was born in Scottsdale, Arizona and raised in Virginia- Roanoke and Chincoteague Island, mostly. I like long walks.... wait. I love technology and what it's doing for the world (as long as it's in the right hands). I've been tinkering with anything my budget would allow since I was a little one.

I've been riding motorcycles from the age of 16- I'm 23 now. I have a love affair with bikes and I am a proud member of the Iron Butt association. I completed 1000 miles in under 24 hours when I was 18.

I'm currently a student studying Mechanical Engineering Technology. The help that I've received for this project in terms of the device itself consist of Keyen Mears and Trevor Marsh. The circuit board is designed by Keyen Mears, and I’ve received countless hours of help from Trevor Marsh in writing the SensePod code.

The purpose of my new company, Project Maple, is to put forth innovations for motorcycles (specifically, helmets) that enable the rider to have a personal, otherwise unobtainable, riding experience.

story:
Presenting our masterpiece, the first truly affordable E Board:
LongRunner - the Long-Range Low-Price eSkateboard!

We are so excited to have been able to source the most affordable parts and in our workings with designers and engineers from Asia, Europe and USA, we have an excellent design that is simple, functional but most of all: long lasting and very cool.

We hand assemble every skateboard and have it tested for functionality, nothing is more important than the durability and reliability, with LongRunner you get both and it looks great!

High and smooth acceleration with sensored brushless HUB-Motor, means you can skate even manually (without motor)! The LongRunner instantly reaches high final speeds of up to 15-20 km/h, and ranges of 10+ Km on its integrated battery. With its smart ExTender Hub, it accepts multiple batteries and our newly developed RangePak easily triples your range, and maintains high Speeds as if you just refreshed your batteries! Even more beautiful: With another external power source, the SmartExTender V2, you can even quadruple range and increase Speed by 40%!

What is the LongRunner?

The LongRunner is  a custom-developed eSkateboard that is based upon a smart selection of standard and low-priced but perfectly working and high quality components. Numerous Asian eSkateboards look alike from the outside, but controllers, batteries, motors used often differ a lot! And many of these similar-looking "drive trains" we tested did not work smoothly at all! Not because they were all bad, but mainly because they had a few wrong parts, they were not configured correctly or simply not used to their full potential! Therefore, we developed the LongRunner!

LongRunner was initially developed with the help of Kickstarter crowdfunding, to provide a flawlessly working and super-performing eSkateboard at a budget price. LongRunner's circuitry enables you to use your custom batteries at two different voltages: 29 and 42V for super (dangerous!) high speed!
The first batch is already in production at our Asian factory, thanks to the help of KS community.  

  • Selection of perfect and low-priced components
  • Standart Housing & wheels and hand-piched & measured electronics
  • ExTender Hub for future-proof upgrades!
  • ExTender Hub for connection of massive range extending RangePak
  • ➜ MoreTechnical Specs can be found in the FAQ section!

What is the RangePak?

The RangePak is a smart composition of high quality, meticulously (UN 38.3-) tested cells in a 7S2P high energy density battery, enclosed in  a protective housing, a fabric-bag, and connected to a neat, safe, well-tested and high current-capable spiral cable that can be attached, upon demand, to your eBoard's smart ExTender Hub (basically a plug on the board). The RangePak can go to your preferred belt, backpack, pocket, but even directly onto the board, simply wherever you like and adapted to your skills!

We had many discussions, and mainly People who never tried criticised the cable, but after they tried, everybody was conviced: With the eSkateboard, once you have a little practice, the use of the cable is totally fine and imposes no significantly increased risks to the rider.  Instead, it enables you to get as many RangePaks as you wish and riiiiiiiiiiiiddeeeee the whole day long!

  • Enables longer lasting high speeds & longer range (3X)
  • can be charged with the regular supplied fast-charger
  • RangePak: triples your range
  • 25.2 V nominal, 29,4 V fully charged
  • Capacity: ~1950 mAh measured
  • Total Energy: 98,3 Wh
  • Dimensions of battery pack: 120 * 40 * 70 mm, 700g 
  • Peak discharge current: 20 A
  • Continuous discharge current: 10 A
  • ➜ MoreTechnical Specs can be found in the FAQ section!

 

UPDATE: CURRENT PRODUCTION STATUS

 

The production of the Longrunner has started - 100 units per day are being assembled right now and shipped to our warehouses. 

 

Our very first contacts with skateboards lie far back, and at that time nobody ever thought about an "electrification"... When we first got into contact with electrical skateboards and got to try it, there was this "wow-feeling", this truly amazing feeling that may remind a surfer of riding a wave with ease, yet in complete silence. The next thing we did was ask for the price, and when we realized that this beautiful toy was offered at several hundred of dollars we were really disappointed and suddenly realized that this was probably the main reason, that there are still only so few of these boards out there. 

Didn't we just see these Segway-like "hover boards" for a mere 200 dollars flooding the markets? These hover boards are electronic gadgets that seem far more complicated than a simple skateboard. We started to think about how to create such a nice toy at a decent price. Such amazing toy should be available and affordable for everybody. A good electrical speed controller (ESC) and decent hub motors as well as standard skateboard components may be required, and these components may not necessarily cost 500 dollars... at this time, our idea was born: We have to create an affordable eSkateboard, affordable for everyone!

After careful testing of different variants of cost-effective motors and controllers we realized that the "ready to use" products that were offered had significant flaws and in some cases even unbearable safety issues. Several aspects were very important for us and simply no issue to the trade-off between performance and price: Motor ratings, ESC programming and solid battery-pack assembly...

Finding the right batteries is a real challenge: Cheap high-capacity batteries are often overrated, the specs are wrongly declared, in fact they might work at low-currents but definitely not in a high-current application such as a skateboard or hover board. High-quality Samsung, LG, Panasonic or Sony-cells are mostly available as either high capacity or high C-rating, with both high Capa + high-C-rated cells being truly expensive. We therefore aimed at a compromise, using a standard, rather low-capacity but well-assembled battery pack for our basic version. We had a look at every single cell, looked at discharge- and charge characteristics and compared temperatures of the cells to high performance batteries from Samsung (29E and 35E). Since charging of any li-cell, regardless of being a high-quality or a low-quality cell, requires strict limits, we decided that our on board battery must be equipped with a battery management system that provides a single cell surveillance function, realizing overcharge and over-discharge protection at the level of the single cells. 

During our tests we did not experience any critical overtemperatures or thermal runaways of our batteries, even at increased stress. Capacity, depending on the current drawn and the discharge cut off voltage, was within our expected range. Instead, not a single of the numerous "high-quality" cells had a capacity that was close to the rated capacity. Therefore we decided to stick with the "standard" batteries for the "standard" version of the LongRunner that seemed safe and according to our measuring capabilities the pack seemed definitely not "dangerously overrated". Each battery is also equipped with a nicely assembled battery management system which worked during our testing as expected.

The on-board energy storage system is definitely not a "Ferrari"- but hey, that was never our intention when creating an "affordable" eSkateboard. "Hot swappable" battery packs are nice, no doubt, we thought about it, but assembly cost was much higher. Simply adding more cells to the board is an option- but makes the board heavy and the feeling of a skateboard is lost- just as the skateboard feeling is lost when you use one of those belt-drive skateboards!

We are so excited to have been able to source the most affordable parts and in our workings with designers and engineers from Asia, Europe and USA, we have an excellent design that is simple, functional but most of all; long lasting and very cool.

Every skateboard is being hand assembled and will be tested by our engineers for functionality, nothing is more important than the durability and reliability, with LongRunner you get both and it looks great!

Our Germany-based team had long been interested in "electro-mobility", which is a huge political issue in Germany and actually in all countries throughout Europe. During our research we realized that many Asian countries had already massively advanced electro-mobility and somehow, during a business trip, we were confronted with electrical scooters, hover boards and - skateboards! These skateboards that we initially came in contact with in Hong Kong were of outstanding quality but were also offered at an extremely unattractively high price. At the same time, components used in RC planes and even hover-board copies were offered at a much, much lower price. Against this background we thought that we must find a way to combine the advantages of the comparably cheap but solid hoverboard components, that are currently flooding the markets, with a neat and sexy skateboard!

With our experience in electric brushless speed controller programming, in optimizing microcontroller-codes and with our patience in bench-testing cheap Chinese batteries and chargers until they truly burst into flames, we went out to China with a specific mission: To find a combination of high quality components that, with only slight modifications could be used to assemble a perfectly working, long-lasting quality longboard: the "Longrunner" was born. A brand was founded and a design created, several prototypes were assembled as per our instructions, bench and field tested.

Many other cheap Chinese-brand boards were tested and even though many components looked alike, there were massive quality and e-design issues concerning not only the battery or insufficient stability, but mainly programming issues or a lack of programmability, which resulted in dangerously accelerating or decelerating motors- something you simply do not want to have in a skateboard.

Therefore we were more than happy when we had all components optimized and ready to be put together to get the final product that we are very, very proud to offer today via Kickstarter: Our Longrunner - truly the first "affordable" electric skateboard.

One of the major issues with these skateboards, but also with hoverboards or other scooters, is battery life. We therefore optimized our components to offer a totally novel feature: CHARGEABILITY during rinding, with our RangePak concept. All boards that we offer are equipped with the feature that enables the board to be "charged" ON THE WAY, while the user is riding the board! Using a set of special connectors and a backpack-based battery system that we developed in Germany and in Hong Kong, this combination gives our backers the chance to experience an unprecedented Independence.

Hello everyone

It’s Monte, you probably know me from the original post where I introduced myself and my two friends: Paul and Alex. 

Many have been asking who is the designer or lets say “whose idea was it for the Long Runner”. Well, as much as I don’t like taking the credit, it was my idea and I will tell you why. 

I live in and love Berlin, I love that the public transportation can get me almost anywhere, as a student I am always on the go, not only to school but meetings and parties and other social activities. 

What really gets on my nerves was the distance between the bus, tram and train stops to my destination, you know how it is: the bus never stops where you wish to get off. So I carried my skateboard with me for these trips, which is really cool…but I in the summer I am all sweaty when I arrive.

I wanted something electric, something with no CO2 exhaust and something that I can carry into the café, classroom or place of business because lets face it; in Berlin, bikes can end up disappearing from the street or hallway pretty quick. 

There is a massive choice of electric skateboards…if you’re rich. That’s my problem; I am not. So my idea came to create a board that was inexpensive enough for a student to buy.

This is when Paul and Alex came into the picture, when it got serious and we decided to move forward. After completing the travels, finding the parts and pricing, we got our friend Julian, who is an Engineer and Scientist to start the process of putting it all together. 

Since we were on a roll we came up with more ideas and the newest one being the range extender, making the distance you can travel much further and faster, this is really cool and it is super practical as an extra battery for those long Saturdays. I also wanted to design it a bit different than others and give it a sort of city feel, which is where the design comes from. Ok not much you can do with a skateboard but I think we made it stand out from all the others; The least expensive, furthest going, fastest E Board on the market…we did it! 

The next step was obviously to find a company that can serve all our needs, and we found one, which happens to be a friend of a friend. Kreativis is a Trading company, which works international, they are hooking us up with Marketing, Sales support, Social Media, videos, Logistics, shipping, sourcing and even production. I never knew selling a product required so much support; it is amazing, we are so very thankful for Kreativis.

So that’s my story guys, thank you for the support, we are doing all we can to make this as cool and as practical and fun as possible, while at the same time, running the business. Thanks for believing in us!

What is the maximum range of the LongRunner? 

Dependent on your weight and the speed and surface you are riding on you can go approx. 6-9 miles with one charge. Using the RangePak the maximum reach will be increased to 24 Miles!

Where will the boards be shipped from?

We have several warehouses around the globe from where the boards are being shipped - to avoid any custom/tax fees for you.

Will the battery be exchangeable? Will you offer modifications / extensions / upgrades?

Yes, we will offer modifications / extensions asap, but: After months of bench testing of various types of batteries we have to say that, with respect to keeping the balance between cost and features, we had to work out a tradeoff between customizability, battery capacity and safety. We are pretty confident that our solutions are somewhat close to the sweet spot between performance+safety vs. cost.

Why are shipping costs fixed to a specific value, regardless of the country I live in?

We chose an average shipping price - one for all countries - as some require costs above 39€, and some below. Most Backers dont come from Europe. We thought this would be quite fair for all. After the campaign we go online with our onlineshop and then give you shipping options adapted to your country.

What is the "max power" of the motor?

It is precisely 327 watts with the onboard battery! The motor itself accepts much higher peak powers though

What is the maximum user weight for the board? 

The max. weight for the LongRunner is about 100 kg / 220 lbs

What is the maximum climbing limit of the board? 

You can go up to a maximum climbing limit of 15° degrees. 

How fast can I go? 

Going in high speed mode, the maximum speed is around 15-25 km/h.*

How long does it take to fully charge the LongRunner? 

It takes about 3 hours to fully charge your board for your next adventure! 

Is it possible to attach the motor to other decks? 

Yes! You can easily detach the board from the motor and attach the motor to your preferred deck

Can I use the LongRunner just like a normal skateboard without damaging the motor? 

Of course you can! The motor shows almost no cogging, which is one of the biggest advantages of the Sensored Hub Motor. 

Is the board/motor water-resistant? 

The motor is generally waterproof but should be dried after riding through a wet environment to avoid corrosion.

When do you start shipping? 

- We plan to start shipping your boards in July! So excited! 

Where can we get spare parts (wheels, motors, controlers, remote, internal battery)?

We will offer replacement parts at a very fair price via our webshop with worldwide coverageand instructions on how to replace parts. With respect to wheels / trucks, you may use your own choice, get it via Amazon etc.. With respect to the controller / motor / remote, we do recommend you get it from us.
A spare certified internal battery will probably be offered at about 35 USD.

Can I re-pair the remote?

Yes you can, even without unscrewing. A simple firmware-programmed trick will do it:

a turn on remote only
b press reset for 5 sec. until all lights flash
c turn on the board

Can someone "take me over" with another remote control?

Certainly not, unless two boards were accidentally paired together in the factory. The protocol is 2.4 GHz wireless, like WIFI or bluetooth, but higher power output than bluetooth.

What are the dimensions of the wheels, the trucks, the board, the bearings, the battery...?

Wheel Dimensions:

We have chosen cost-effective standard wheels with the following dimensions:
72 mm diameter,
Z809 Bearings,
M8 self-locking nuts
51 mm track

Trucks:

Distance between inner sides of wheels: 118 mm
Distance between outer sides of wheels: 220 mm
14 mm self locking nut (kingpin)
Standard rubber bushings
Hanger width about 170 mm
Axle width 220 mm

Note: Distance between holes in the contact plate for mounting the deck are compatible with both old school and new school dimensions ( six hole plates!) This would be about 62 mm / 52 mm and 42 mm between the holes.
We made sure that the dimensions are completely compatible with high-class tracks / decks that you may wish to use at some point

Deck dimensions (approx.):

200 mm * 700 mm * 25 mm.
You can use any other deck at your own discretion!

Internal battery dimensions (approx.):

height: 20 mm
width: 75 mm
length: 135 mm

Whats the weight of the Board?

Board’s weight is apprx. 3.4 kg

During our testing sessions, which took place on a smooth and even surface, we did not even dare to go at full speed on high mode, so be safe! Always wear a helmet and proper safety equipment! Needless to say that all performance data severely depend upon the user’s weight, the surface (smooth asphalt or concrete street vs. gravelly roads), the inclination, whether you are riding sharp curves or just going straight.
story_txt:
Presenting our masterpiece, the first truly affordable E Board:LongRunner - the Long-Range Low-Price eSkateboard!

We are so excited to have been able to source the most affordable parts and in our workings with designers and engineers from Asia, Europe and USA, we have an excellent design that is simple, functional but most of all: long lasting and very cool.
We hand assemble every skateboard and have it tested for functionality, nothing is more important than the durability and reliability, with LongRunner you get both and it looks great!
High and smooth acceleration with sensored brushless HUB-Motor, means you can skate even manually (without motor)! The LongRunner instantly reaches high final speeds of up to 15-20 km/h, and ranges of 10+ Km on its integrated battery. With its smart ExTender Hub, it accepts multiple batteries and our newly developed RangePak easily triples your range, and maintains high Speeds as if you just refreshed your batteries! Even more beautiful: With another external power source, the SmartExTender V2, you can even quadruple range and increase Speed by 40%!

What is the LongRunner?
The LongRunner is  a custom-developed eSkateboard that is based upon a smart selection of standard and low-priced but perfectly working and high quality components. Numerous Asian eSkateboards look alike from the outside, but controllers, batteries, motors used often differ a lot! And many of these similar-looking "drive trains" we tested did not work smoothly at all! Not because they were all bad, but mainly because they had a few wrong parts, they were not configured correctly or simply not used to their full potential! Therefore, we developed the LongRunner!
LongRunner was initially developed with the help of Kickstarter crowdfunding, to provide a flawlessly working and super-performing eSkateboard at a budget price. LongRunner's circuitry enables you to use your custom batteries at two different voltages: 29 and 42V for super (dangerous!) high speed!The first batch is already in production at our Asian factory, thanks to the help of KS community.  

Selection of perfect and low-priced components
Standart Housing & wheels and hand-piched & measured electronics
ExTender Hub for future-proof upgrades!
ExTender Hub for connection of massive range extending RangePak
➜ MoreTechnical Specs can be found in the FAQ section!

What is the RangePak?
The RangePak is a smart composition of high quality, meticulously (UN 38.3-) tested cells in a 7S2P high energy density battery, enclosed in  a protective housing, a fabric-bag, and connected to a neat, safe, well-tested and high current-capable spiral cable that can be attached, upon demand, to your eBoard's smart ExTender Hub (basically a plug on the board). The RangePak can go to your preferred belt, backpack, pocket, but even directly onto the board, simply wherever you like and adapted to your skills!
We had many discussions, and mainly People who never tried criticised the cable, but after they tried, everybody was conviced: With the eSkateboard, once you have a little practice, the use of the cable is totally fine and imposes no significantly increased risks to the rider.  Instead, it enables you to get as many RangePaks as you wish and riiiiiiiiiiiiddeeeee the whole day long!

Enables longer lasting high speeds & longer range (3X)
can be charged with the regular supplied fast-charger
RangePak: triples your range
25.2 V nominal, 29,4 V fully charged
Capacity: ~1950 mAh measured
Total Energy: 98,3 Wh
Dimensions of battery pack: 120 * 40 * 70 mm, 700g 
Peak discharge current: 20 A
Continuous discharge current: 10 A
➜ MoreTechnical Specs can be found in the FAQ section!

story:
Zero Gravity Racks creates more storage space from a seldom used area, up high. Other storage options don’t free up additional room.

 

 

Store your skis out of the way during the summer or store your surfboards during the winter months, clearing valuable floor space and creating tidier, more useful space.

 

Zero Gravity Racks safely secures your equipment out of the way so they don’t get scratched, damaged, or broken.

 

 

 

Ideal for storing equipment in tight places, where floor space is at a premium. Create more space by storing your gear overhead and out of the way.

 

 

 

The unique gas strut system makes it easy to raise and lower heavy items with minimal effort on your part. Zero Gravity Racks handles the brunt of the weight so you don’t have to, while raising or lowering quickly and smoothly.

 

 

The innovative safety lock ensures that the load stays locked into place when fully raised to the ceiling preventing any kind of accidental release.

 

  

Zero Gravity Racks are intuitively designed for easy installation right out of the box. Just drill the racks into the wall and you’re good to go.

Easy-on, easy-off accessibility saves you precious energy. 

 

 

 

 

 

In order to get the costs to a price we believe creates value for our customers, we need to have a large initial production run. Our goal is to raise half of what we need for the initial production run and fund the other half out of our own pockets. We have already invested substantially in the design process as well as getting ready to bring Zero Gravity Racks to the market and we intend to invest more of our own capital moving forward.

story:
Only 360 units of this first edition Radiant Carbon will be produced worldwide. It is a truly special e-bike to launch this exciting new brand - The Ride Bikes - entirely put together by world-renowned bike designer, Tony Ellsworth. Each owner of the 360 available units will be able to video chat personally with Tony. As one of 360, you will always be a special part of The Ride Bikes' journey.  

We're giving the Indiegogo community first dibs on these units. Check out this interview with Tony about his inspiration behind the Radiant Carbon and what he has planned for The Ride Bikes brand:

 

 

The Ride Bikes' Radiant Carbon is an innovative Class 1 electric bike with Stepless Auto-Shifting AND a single-body Universal Fit Carbon Fiber Frame, mindfully designed by Tony Ellsworth for riders from 5’ to 6’4”. It is packed with enough power to ride more than 100 miles with a carbon belt drive that will last you for more than a decade. What makes it the world's most advanced Class 1 electric bike is its intuitive combination of world-class technologies that allow you keep your cadence even when you face a hill or gravelly surface while seated comfortably on a fully balanced universal fit carbon fiber frame. It's not just "parts hanging on a cheap frame". The Radiant Carbon intelligently reads your bio response using cadence, torque and speed sensors to tell the motor and transmission when to shift, how to shift and how much electric boost to give so you can keep your riding pace without having to think about it. 

Imagine getting the full wide-gearing experience of a high-end mountain bike without having to shift gears or deal with rusting chains. Watch this avid mountain-biker's reaction after trying the Radiant Carbon:

 

If you haven't heard of Tony Ellsworth, it may surprise you to know he's been building and releasing high-quality, high-end carbon fiber mountain bikes for more than 30 years. Ellsworth is a notable name in the cycling world. He holds 14 international patents and is a rare recipient of the Popular Science Grandmaster Recreational Equipment Award. His bikes have been enjoyed by the bike pro and the everyday person alike.

Now, here we are. Tony wanted to build an electric bike he'd want to have for himself. But, also one that would allow the average person to experience the awesome full wide-gearing of a mountain bike without ever having to think about shifting. 

 

Whatever level you contribute at, you'll be able to:

 

How our "perks" work:

  • Your deposit (the "perk" you choose) determines when you will get your Radiant Carbon shipped and how much of a discount you receive.
  • Once you make your deposit, we will contact you to schedule a one-on-one video call with Tony.
  • Before we ship your Radiant Carbon, we will need you to pay the balance for the e-bike at the discounted price you're receiving based on your "perk" deposit. Financing will be available after the Indiegogo campaign for you to pay the balance if you want to do it this way.
  • Once final payment is received by the deadline date stated in the "perk" you choose, we will ship your Radiant Carbon from among the units shipping in the month that your "perk" guarantees delivery. 

 

With more than 30 years of high-end bike manufacturing experience and relationships, Tony Ellsworth and his team are well-equipped to overcome many of the challenges one may face in bringing an electric bike to the market.

The delivery of your Radiant Carbon e-bike is guaranteed with your deposit at any level. Watch Tony's visit with the team at our fulfillment center in San Diego to inspect the Radiant Carbon shipment:

 

We understand that some of you may not be able to contribute at the level we are asking (at this time), but you may still want to be a part. You can still be a part by helping us spread the word by sharing our campaign with your friends and family.

story:
Why we design VIFLY R220?

VIFLY team consists of several FPV Racer enthusiasts. We really enjoy the passion and fun that the drone racing brings, but we know the threshold is a little bit high for many beginners. So we are thinking if we can make a drone to lower the threshold and let more people can fly the racing drone. Then VIFLY R220 is born, it is a 100% ready-to-fly FPV Racer, no assemble, no calibration, just fly it out of the box. We employ a brand new unified body design which makes the drone compact and the performance of anti-crashing is amazing. In addition, we add many smart designs, ie, LED display to show the battery voltage and channel information, one button to switch the video transmission channel and output power, DVR port design, warning buzzer, etc. All things what we do is to make flying FPV Racer easier.


What makes VIFLY R220 different?

Unified Body Design

VIFLY R220 employs unified body design which makes the motors, OSD module, video transmitter and all other electrical components neatly installed within the main airframe.  It addition, this design combines with the carbon fiber airframe which makes the drone compact and brings perfect anti-crashing performance.

Ready to Fly

VIFLY R220 comes ready to fly right out of the box, with assembled drone body including FPV camera , OSD module and video transmitter. The package also comes with remote controller, battery, charger and propellers.



220mm wheelbase
220mm wheelbase makes VIFLY R220 racing drone much smaller than normal 250mm FPV drones that means it will give you faster and agiler flight experience.


High Speed Flight
VIFLY R220 is driven by four 2205 size 2300kv motors running on a 3S/4S battery pack which means it is very powerful that the speed can reach up to 60 miles per hour.


LED display to show the battery voltage and channel information

VIFLY R220 added the LED screen where the battery voltage can be displayed when plug in. In addition, the video transmission channel can be showed when you switch it.  It provides great convenience for the pilot.


One button to switch the channel and output power

VIFLY R220 uses tact switch to replace traditional DIP switch which makes the channel and power changing much easier.


DVR Ready

VIFLY R220 reserves the port for the DVR module, just plug it and you can record the video onboard.

Warning Buzzer
The buzzer will alert you when the low voltage threshold has been reached. Also it will help you locate the drone if it lands out of sight.
         

Anti-Crash & Angle Adjustable Camera

The camera body is made from rubber for better protection. The camera angle is adjustable from 0 to 90 degrees for better field of view in various speed.



GoPro Mount 

If you want to record HD video during your flight, the GoPro Mount allows you to hook up a GoPro very easily and firmly.


FPV Goggle 

Comfortable video viewing with detachable 4.3'' auto scan receiver monitor. High brightness 500cd/m2. Lightweight only 380g, including rechargeable 2000mA battery. It is optional and only included in the Advanced Package Perk. 

 


What Pilots Say About VIFLY R220

Review from Dustin Dunnill

Review from Quadcopter101


VIFLY R220 Tech Specs


Timeline


Perks


Contact

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at support@viflydrone.com or www.facebook.com/viflydrone. We will respond as fast as possible!

For press inquiries please contact sales@viflydrone.com.

story:
:: V-space E-Scooter

Visionary Mobility is proud to bring you the V-space E-scooter, a high powered electric scooter for high-powered urbanites and even sub-urbanites that want to get places quickly, comfortably, and in style. The V-space 60 is the brainchild of countless hours of design, testing, development, and listening to what electric vehicle users had to say.

:: THE V-SPACE 60

From the finishing on the aluminum alloy to the comfort-durability seats and hefty wheels on the V-Space 60, you will be able to feel an immediate appreciation for the time and dedication that went into crafting each model.

But don't let us tell you how good it is, find out for yourself!

 

:: User Guide Video

 

 

 

① Smart Battery System

  • Powerful, safe, highly efficiency and smart.
  • Battery Management System CONTROL
  • Battery cell temperatures, voltages, currents estimation algorithm
  • SOC : Stage of Charge calculation
  • SOH : Stage of Health estimation
  • Charge/Discharge Power estimation
  • Cell Balancing algorithm
  • Low power algorithm
  • Communication algorithm

 

② Powerful Battery

 

# Long battery life for up to 70,000 miles.

# 18650 Li-ion Battery by BEXEL

 

BEXEL is a highly skilled company that has launched Korea's first LI-ion secondary battery development. Based on their long-accumulated primary cell technology and know-how, they developed a cylindrical type LI-ion battery. They are currently supplying products to the South Korean military.

We applied BEXEL's superior battery to V-space. Our products can expect high performance due to their excellent battery charging capabilities, long life expectancy, and efficiency.

 

③ Smart Inverter

Development of M2M-based Digital Control System

  • Collect information from each sensor to provide the optimum service condition
  • Based on residual gauge, show the remaining distance that the vehicle can travel
  • USI(universal serial interface) use of interface of sensor module
  • USI has three-wire controller mode, micro controller has master
  • Sensor uses slave to control and converts the sensor signals to A/D
  • Manage the signals

 

④ 100% Digital Control

LCD Instrument Panel

The LCD instrument panel in V-SPACE provides all necessary information for operation, including battery SOC, speed, mileage, and vehicle abnormalities

  • LED Lighting

Headlights, rear lamps, front and rear direction indicators all operate on LEDs.

  • Digital + Digital for Smart Phone

We've applied a smart phone hanger and a charging system to V-space. The smartphone always identifies the various information that the driver needs.

 

 

If you want to customize this scooter, you can put your signs on

You can engrave your signature on a board under the scooter's saddle with a laser engraver. You can carve one side or both.

Send us your Indiegogo account and backer info

If you want to customize, please send us a text to print in our email below. Please contact us after this campaign has been successful in raising funds.

 

#BOARD SIZE :  7x1.5 inches (180x40mm)

 

:: We are V-Mobility, Visionary Mobility

 

 

Visionary Mobility is no stranger to the world of electric vehicles. In fact, we have been producing electric vehicles being used by the Korean government, corporations including McDonalds, and end users like you!

 

 

We are collaborating with the Korean Aerospace Research Institute (think Korean NASA) and other entities regarding our electric battery technology and their applications in the form of electric vehicles. All that to say, we know how to make (kick-butt) electric vehicles that do the work for you while making you look good.

 

 

:: Our Story

 

Visionary Mobility has developed technologies related to electric batteries and powertrains for years, and we have developed various vehicles that make use of our effective battery applications and powerful powertrains such as electric bicycles, scooters, and single-seater automobiles.

We want to show you a ride that can go longer, run faster, and be more useful.

 


 

The quality of the technology that controls the battery is as important as using a good battery.  A proper control system must distribute and transmit energy efficiently to the motor without wasting energy so that electric vehicle can run faster and longer.

 

Our technology has been widely recognized as a top-rated solution by the likes of the Korean Aerospace Research Institute.  We supplied our products to South Korean government agencies and global companies and have been recognized for our competitiveness in battery control technology and powertrain reliability.

 

 

Our technology has been widely recognized as a top-rated solution by the likes of the Korean Aerospace Research Institute.  We supplied our products to South Korean government agencies and global companies and have been recognized for our competitiveness in battery control technology and powertrain reliability.

 

We have developed and designed a variety of electric vehicles over the years and have been able to aggregate a large volume of data to optimize our development of different kinds of vehicles.

 

 

Based on this data, we applied the right sizes and technologies to our products to give you the optimal ride.  The V-Space60 contains our thoughts and philosophies on what a proper electric scooter should strive to be.

We hope you enjoy.

 

 

 

:: Risks and Challenges

 

We have finished development of the V-Space 60 and are working on making sure we can deliver the V-Space to you on time. As a large product, we understand there may be potential delays that are unforseen at this time. We take our user's satisfaction very seriously and will communicate with you well ahead of time should any such delays occur to ensure successful fulfillment.

story:
Who we are: 

The Southern Polytechnic State University Electric Vehicle Team (SPSU EVT) located in Marietta, GA strives to push transportation technology and innovation through competition. The team is comprised of students with majors ranging from Electrical Engineering/ Technology, Mechanical Engineering/ Technology, Mechatronics, Business, and New Media Arts. 

 

What we are doing:

We have designed and started building an electric motorcycle to race in the FIM eRoadRacing (TTXGP) North American Series. FIM eRoadRacing is the world's largest zero-emissions motorcycle racing organization after the TTXGP and FIM joined forces and takes place in North America and Europe. This is a professional event, and the competition consists of collegiate teams and teams of industry that will build electric motorcycles and race them on a road course to compete for the fastest time. The ultimate goal is not only to place well in the race but to assist in further developing the world of electric transportation and alternative energy. Concepts designed on a race vehicle can and will be implemented in future transportation for practical, every day use. 

 

About the motorcycle:

This year's motorcycle will consist of a lightweight aluminum chassis, high powered lithium-polymer battery pack, AC induction motor, liquid cooling system, and much more that will be unveiled soon. 

 

Why we need your help:

As a first year team our resources have been limited. The first year is always the hardest, but this has not stopped us. The motorcycle build process has been started and will be finished with the help of supporters on indiegogo. We thank you in advance for your support and hope that you are as excited to be a part of history in the making as we are!

 

Resources:

Our Facebook: www.facebook.com/Spsuevt

Our Website: http://spsu.orgsync.com/org/spsuevt

Race Organization's website: http://ttxgp.com/

 

  • Be on the lookout for updates (pictures and video) on this campaign page and on our Facebook page.

  •  for further info please email trowan@spsu.edu or spsuevteam@gmail.com

story:
Tested by backers for backers. We have learnt a lot our first Kickstarter, the most important lesson being: listen to the backers. To make sure we designed the best possible product for the Mk II, we used 20 of our Kickstarter backers in our testing program where they put the board to the test with daily rides sending weekly performance reports straight to our engineering team. Taking on board what our test riders had to say, we perfected our Mk II design to ensure that we would deliver an incredible product.  

 

The Mk II features the latest technologies allowing it to boast some of the most impressive features as well as specs of any board out on the market

 

The Mk II motor kit is built around in-wheel hub motor technology. Our hub motors give the kit its sleek look and removability while still delivering 2000W of power to the ground each to give the Mk II's remarkable performance. The compact design also allows for our boards to free-wheel like a standard longboard without significant resistance. We build all our boards to a high-quality standard to ensure that all our customers get the most out of the motor kits. Our assembly process includes rigorous quality control systems and we use the highest quality materials practically obtainable. The kits are made modular so that in the case of a breakdown, it can be quickly and efficiently repaired by replacing specific parts rather than fully replaced each time.

 

 

2WD TO 4WD

Slap two Mk II kits onto a single deck to create a more powerful 4WD ride. The Mk II's modular design allows for each motor kit to be paired together on single deck for 4WD or for each to be mounted onto separate decks to create two standard boards.

USE ANY DECK

Install the Mk II and its front trucks like any ordinary trucks on any standard skateboard deck. Strap the Mk II onto the board of your choice to create the perfect ride for you.

ON-ROAD TO OFF-ROAD

Easily swap out our standard on-road wheels for larger, grippier off-road wheels at any time. Swap out your ride-to-work on-road wheels for your off-road wheels. Change your wheels easily at any time to match your riding style and environment.

 

REPLACEABLE BATTERIES

Quickly swap out your dead battery for a fresh one to instantly double your range and keep the ride going. Bring a few extra batteries in your bag to even triple or quadruple your range.

 

KEY FEATURES

The Mk II 4WD is the most powerful electric skateboard currently on the market with a total of 4000W of power allowing for extreme hill-climb capability. The 4WD is capable of climbing hills of up to 43%, easily steeper than the steepest hills in most cities. Check out what the 4WD can do.

 

 

 

IvoryBoard Mark II

 

IvoryBoard Crashes the Red Carpet ARIAS

 

The Electric Uprising

 

Ride Anywhere

 

Ride The Power

 

Coast & Cruise

 

IvoryBoard Customers ♥

 

IvoryBoard Highlights

 

Mark I vs Pro Dutch Skater

 

 

BRAND COLLABORATIONS

 
 
The Mk II remote provides easy, reliable, wireless control over your motor kit. It’s an all-in-one control center that fits in the palm of your hand. It gives you complete control over acceleration, braking, and user modes. It’s also got a charge indicator for your main battery and one for the remote itself. And it’s ergonomic design and safety lanyard ensure it stays in your hand on even the most exhilarating rides!

1 x Battery Pack

1 x Charger

1 x Truck

story_txt:
Tested by backers for backers. We have learnt a lot our first Kickstarter, the most important lesson being: listen to the backers. To make sure we designed the best possible product for the Mk II, we used 20 of our Kickstarter backers in our testing program where they put the board to the test with daily rides sending weekly performance reports straight to our engineering team. Taking on board what our test riders had to say, we perfected our Mk II design to ensure that we would deliver an incredible product.   The Mk II features the latest technologies allowing it to boast some of the most impressive features as well as specs of any board out on the market The Mk II motor kit is built around in-wheel hub motor technology. Our hub motors give the kit its sleek look and removability while still delivering 2000W of power to the ground each to give the Mk II's remarkable performance. The compact design also allows for our boards to free-wheel like a standard longboard without significant resistance. We build all our boards to a high-quality standard to ensure that all our customers get the most out of the motor kits. Our assembly process includes rigorous quality control systems and we use the highest quality materials practically obtainable. The kits are made modular so that in the case of a breakdown, it can be quickly and efficiently repaired by replacing specific parts rather than fully replaced each time.  2WD TO 4WDSlap two Mk II kits onto a single deck to create a more powerful 4WD ride. The Mk II's modular design allows for each motor kit to be paired together on single deck for 4WD or for each to be mounted onto separate decks to create two standard boards.USE ANY DECKInstall the Mk II and its front trucks like any ordinary trucks on any standard skateboard deck. Strap the Mk II onto the board of your choice to create the perfect ride for you.ON-ROAD TO OFF-ROADEasily swap out our standard on-road wheels for larger, grippier off-road wheels at any time. Swap out your ride-to-work on-road wheels for your off-road wheels. Change your wheels easily at any time to match your riding style and environment. REPLACEABLE BATTERIESQuickly swap out your dead battery for a fresh one to instantly double your range and keep the ride going. Bring a few extra batteries in your bag to even triple or quadruple your range. KEY FEATURESThe Mk II 4WD is the most powerful electric skateboard currently on the market with a total of 4000W of power allowing for extreme hill-climb capability. The 4WD is capable of climbing hills of up to 43%, easily steeper than the steepest hills in most cities. Check out what the 4WD can do.

 


 

 
IvoryBoard Mark II


 
IvoryBoard Crashes the Red Carpet ARIAS

 
The Electric Uprising

 
Ride Anywhere

 
Ride The Power

 
Coast & Cruise

 
IvoryBoard Customers ♥


 
IvoryBoard Highlights


 
Mark I vs Pro Dutch Skater


 



 
BRAND COLLABORATIONS



 
 


The Mk II remote provides easy, reliable, wireless control over your motor kit. It’s an all-in-one control center that fits in the palm of your hand. It gives you complete control over acceleration, braking, and user modes. It’s also got a charge indicator for your main battery and one for the remote itself. And it’s ergonomic design and safety lanyard ensure it stays in your hand on even the most exhilarating rides!

story:
CHRISTINI AWD mountain bikes were first introduced back in 2001 with production AWD hardtail and full suspension models.  The company partnered with a few small builders and some of the big guys too to make a unique, all purpose, trail bike that could go through just about anything.  Our company continued to grow and we soon moved into AWD motorcycle production.  As a result, the bikes were put on hold while the company grew.

Fast forward to 2013 and Kate Leeming entered the picture.  Kate called us to see if it was possible to build her a custom All Wheel Drive Fat Bike to help her with succeed in an expedition across Antarctica via the South Pole.  We decided to jump right in and build her a custom bike using some of the parts we still had around from the bike days.  So we came up with a 4" Fat version with a split frame design.  And sure enough.... the bike performed great!

CHRISTINAWD 4" Fat Split Frame Design

Video of Kate's first test of the AWD 4" Fat bike: 

Video of the training on the 4" Fat:

Assembling the first Fat bike

 

 
The test of the first 4" AWD Fat Bike was so successful that we decided to build Kate the ultimate bike to cross Antarctica.  Thus the 5" AWD Fat Bike came to life, taking some tricks from our full suspension bikes to get the wide rear tire to clear the drive shaft.  Add some creative engineering with top of the line components and you have a 'traction-packed' AWD Fat Bike that weighs in at an incredible 32lbs!.

CHRISTINI AWD 5" Fat - Kate's South Pole bike

Video of the successful training expedition in Greenland: 

Our goal with this campaign is not only to get you on one of the coolest Fat bikes around, but to get Kate safely across the continent of Antarctica via the South Pole!  So please be part of history and help make this expedition a reality by grabbing an AWD Fat Bike or another perk.

Thanks to everyone from Steve Christini and Kate Leeming!

Why AWD on a bike?

Many people assume 2wd and 4wd are the same as AWD. We call our bikes AWD rather than 2wd as they operate as a smart system or what people call "posi-traction". The bike is always rear wheel drive except when the rear wheel slips. At that instant, the power of the slipping rear wheel will transfer power to the front wheel overrunning clutch, thus pulling the bike forward. When that happens, the rear wheel will find a new point of traction and then the power will go back to rear wheel. So it is amazingly efficient and only transfers power when you need it.  

In summary, the bike becomes a traction machine on hill climbs, but even more impressive is the ability to have a traction control system on fast downhill descents. If the front wheel decelerates while going down a hill and around a loose corner (skids), the slowing front wheel will be pushed along by the rear wheel, thus allowing the rider to have a controlled two wheel slide. Picture a rally car sliding around a corner but still having total control.   

All Wheel Drive is much more noticeable than anyone would think. And for the 2.3lbs added weight, if you're an aggressive rider, or just like traction, AWD can't be beat!

What We Need & What You Get

To accomplish this amazing expedition across Antarctica  starting in December of 2017, Kate needs to raise over $300,000 for travel, support, film crew and other expenses.  As the builders of the bikes, we at Christini need to raise the initial $20,000 to finish the machined parts in order to produce the first AWD Fat bikes.  All of the proceeds of the Breaking The Cycle perks will go to the expedition.  5% of all the AWD Fat bike sales will go towards Kate's expedition.  We know that raising all the funds through this campaign will be difficult, but we are hopeful that we will be off to a great start with your help!

The Impact

Help be a part of history and join in the effort to fund Kate's expedition across Antarctica.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help us with our campaign at this time, you can still donate to Kate' expedition by going directly to her website at www.kateleeming.com

Risks & Challenges

The CHRISTINI AWD Fat Bikes are not the first bikes we've made.  In fact, the first mountain bike we ever made was back in 1999.  We collaborated with many other companies and have worked with and tested with some of the industry leaders like Geoff Ringle and Gary Fisher (who loves our bikes!).   We've been building weird/cool stuff for over 15 years. 

Our goal with this campaign is to help Kate get succeed in one of the most ambitious biking expeditions of all time and making it across Antarctica via the South Pole!

With that said, we will complete each and every order that we receive.  We promise to stick to the initial limited special edition delivery timeline and will roll out the remaining bikes in a first ordered, first out the door delivery schedule.

If you have any questions about our ability to deliver and customer service, just search the web for what other customers have to say.  We pride ourselves in being honest and fair and never letting anyone down.

Thanks for your support!  

Steve Christini

The Hat, T-Shirts, and Jersey

story:
The FLIT-16 is a brand new generation of folding electric bike.

Developed in Cambridge, England by an ex Jaguar Land Rover engineer, we've designed it from scratch to be the best in its class: it is not only the best looking folding ebike, but also the best to ride. 

With the FLIT-16, all of your city journeys will be fast, fun and effortless. 

This is your chance to be one of the very first to have one.

 

 
 

FULL SPECIFICATION TABLE: 

As designers, engineers and cyclists based in Cambridge, UK, the FLIT team has been inspired by the amazing cycling culture of our city. We love the way that bikes make our cities feel more human and connected, and the sense of freedom that they give. 

Dave and Alex (co-founders) met in 2015 whilst studying in Beijing. An ex Jaguar Land Rover engineer, Dave had long been interested in electric vehicles and dreamed of building his own. For Alex, a public policy graduate who had cycled across both the USA and China, the vision was to help make our cities happier and healthier places to live.

Electric bikes were their favourite way of zipping between lectures or to their favourite restaurants. Being such a fast and fun way of getting round, it got them thinking that more people should use ebikes to get around back home.

They relocated to Cambridge, the cycling capital of the UK to begin the FLIT story, designing our folding electric bike from a blank sheet of paper. Over the past 3 years we’ve turned our pencilled sketches into fully working prototypes, beautifully designed so that you can’t even tell that they’re electric. The fold gives you the flexibility to take it with you anywhere, whilst adding a motor makes journeys effortless, fast and fun. 

 

We are proud to have partnered with a Taiwanese specialist aluminium bike manufacturer with over 30 years' experience in the industry to build the FLIT-16. We've been working with them for over a year now - our final prototypes were built using by them using manufacturing tooling.

We chose to manufacture our ebike in Taiwan as it a world renowned manufacturing hub for specialist and high-end bike frames, particularly aluminium ones. Folding bikes are complex, so it's been really great to work with such experienced partners who understand the complexities involved.

story: The South Park Rail Society Has been offered a fundraising opportunity by the Narrow Gauge Preservation foundation. It is a matching grant in the amount of $1125 for shop tools and materials needed to support the operation and maintenance of Klondike Mines #4 ( Klondike Kate) In Como Colorado. The foundation has challenged the SPRS to raise $1125 thru individual donations over the next two months, as a show of support from the Rail fan and preservation community for our project to return steam operations to Como. As a show of support we need as many donors as possible. In this instance the amount donated may actually be less important than the number of donors. Please consider a donation to the SPRS. We could really use your support with this key fundraising campaign.
