story:
Meet Transboard

Transboard combines sleek, smooth lines and advanced mobility all in an amazing 3-wheel scooter.

 

Transboard is perfect for work, play or anywhere you need to get places quickly and in style:

  • Design - Smooth, sleek, and utterly stylish, the Transboard combines function with comfort wrapped in a beautiful modern aesthetic.
  • Performance - A fast, smooth ride, the Transboard cruises at speeds up to 22 miles per hour and takes corners with ease.
  • Technology - The Transboard is on the cutting edge of scooter technology, making for a more comfortable and safe ride whether in an urban or rural environment.

Touted as the most advanced three-wheel scooter around, Transboard is the perfect blend of cutting edge mechanical engineering and stunning design.

  • Safe and easy to use
  • Eco-friendly
  • Double wishbone suspension and rev-tricycle frame
  • Modern, sleek look

It's fun to ride and because it goes up to speeds of 22 MPH, you'll get to your destination quickly and efficiently. When you're done, simply use the one-touch fold up system to pull Transboard behind you with ease, just like you would do your luggage, or store in a smaller space. It's just that easy.

    

                          

 

                          Click Here For Media Kit

Not your ordinary scooter, Transboard is self-balancing, making it easy for anyone to use -- even it's your first time on a scooter . There are no complicated instructions or special education necessary. Just ride and enjoy!

Transboard keeps outstanding running stability and is comfortable to ride. In addition, this awesome scooter always provides the best driving performance by high-performance 500W BLDC HUB motor delivering powerful torque and top speeds of 22 miles per hour.

 

Our unique modified double wishbone suspension and rev-tricycle frame make for a much smoother and more enjoyable experience when you're on the go.

Notice how smooth the transition is from side to side-

Transboard's simple one-touch fold up system allows the scooter to be easily pulled behind you, much like carry-on luggage. It also makes it smaller for storage.

The Transboard is not only efficient, it's also a sexy looking machine. The outer shell is composed of polycarbonate, which is not only strong and absorbs external shock, it provides a high-gloss, sleek finish that fits in with it's smooth and stylish lines, much like the body of a high-end car.

Transboard is so much more than a safe and stylish way to ride. Transboard also delivers on performance.

  • Top speed of 22 MPH
  • Goes up to 25 miles on a single 6 hour charge

Why drive or take the bus to work in excruciatingly slow traffic when you can make your commute fun and fast with Transboard?

 

 

 

 

  • Die-cast CNC process for a sturdy frame
  • Can carry up to 220 pounds safely, easily, and smoothly

Transboard's double wishbone suspension and rev-tricycle frame keep you more comfortable even over uneven terrain. The vehicle absorbs and adapts to flaws in your path to give you the best experience possible.

 

The Transboard's LED screen displays speed, distance, power measurements, and other important functions. Using five buttons on the bottom of the display, you can power up your Transboard, set your trip distance, change the display mode, and so much more. It's easy to use and gives you the information you need quickly.

We care about your safety as number one priority, Transboard has taillights during day/night time for your safe, yet, enjoyable ride.

Our unique one-touch full-folding system makes it convenient to take your Transboard anywhere. Simply fold up with the touch of a button and pull like you would any kind of lightweight luggage.

 

  • Light but mighty
  • Absorbs and resist the bumps and grinds of the road
  • Works with the suspension system to give you a smoother, safer ride

Because the Transboard has a detachable battery, it can be charged anywhere separately from the scooter itself -- perfect for those with a busy lifestyle.

 

Want to go further with your Transboard?  Get our latest Perk, an additional 48V/4.3Ah Battery System allowing you to travel an additional 12.4 miles/20 km when the main battery needs charging. Located between the footpads, this battery is fits in perfectly and is easily detachable. This perk comes in either black or white and you will be able to select your desired color in a survey after the campaign.

 

We know you'll want to keep your Transboard in motion, so having a couple of spare tires on hand is a smart way to plan ahead. These Two Extra Front Tires are our latest unlocked perk, thanks to our dedicated community of generous backers. Get them for 50% off ($50 off) before the campaign ends!

 

 

Our goal was to create the perfect riding experience that melded functionality, safety, and aesthetic design into something that everyone could use. But Transboard isn't just a leap forward in scooter technology, it's also a step forward for tech innovation and those who love it.

Imagine yourself owning the world's most advanced 3-wheel scooter...

Our design and development process had one simple goal: to maker a safer, sleeker scooter that could easily be used in different environments. Transboard is the culmination of our efforts: one of the most advanced and innovative 3-wheel scooters of our time. This is a giant leap forward not only in scooter technology, but in bringing the technology to a larger consumer base. We don't want to just develop cool things, we want to make sure that people like you have access to something truly efficient and safe.

Do you ship worldwide?

Yes, we ship to worldwide.  Please check the shipping fee for the country that you are in. If you have any further inquiries regarding shipping cost. Please let us know.

Why are there shipping costs?

Since we're offering the Transboard at such an extremely reduced rate for those who support our Indiegogo campaign, we have no margin to offer free shipping. Our goal is get you the lowest rate so you can experience the Transboard for yourself before they're released onto the market. We do not set the shipping fees and we present them to you without mark-up. Shipping costs are as follows:

European Union:   $295

United States:        $145

Canada:                     $175

Republic of Korea: $145

Taiwan:                      $175

China:                         $145

Singapore:                $145

Rest of the world:   $235

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT for International Orders?

Import duty tax or VAT may need to be paid if your country requires it. –VAT

Is there a warranty on my Transboard?

Yes. We offer six (6) months limited warranty on all Transboard purchases. All parts that are broken or defective due to manufacturers error are covered and will be shipped free of charge. Note: this does not include damages incurred by rider usage. Any alteration, tampering or modification of the electronics, battery, controller, throttle, motor, circuitry or related electrical wiring will not be serviced or supported by Transboard and will void the warranty.

How long does it take to fully charge the battery?

Approximately 6 hours with our standard charger if the battery pack is completely empty.

Will the charger work in my country, and internationally?

Yes. The chargers have an operating range of 110-220VAC, 50/60Hz, and covers most countries.

Can the Transboard climb hills?

Absolutely. The Transboard can climb hills up to 15 degrees.

How long of a lifecycle does the battery have?

Transboard uses a Li-ion battery, and it will last over 500 cycles. After 500 cycles, the performance of battery will start to decrease.

What is the maximum weight to ride a Transboard?

The Transboard has the best performance for hill climbing and full suspension capabilities bearing up to a maximum weight of 220lbs (100kg).

What color choices do you offer?

Currently we offer a black model and a white model.

How do I get replacement parts?

After the campaign ends, we will sell replacement parts online through our website where you can purchase components, accessories and even another Transboard. For rules on replacement parts due to manufacturers defect, see above.

Where can Transboards be serviced?

Transboards are designed to be simple enough for anyone to replace parts on their own. However, after the campaign, we plan on inviting A/S centers in major states to help us extend our repair and replacement services to the public.

If I want to be a rep/distributor/retailer, where do I start?

We are open to retailers worldwide. If you have a retail store where Transboard would be a good addition to your stock, inquire by emailing us at info@mercane.com.

How can I contact you?

You can email us anytime at info@mercane.com or like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/mercanewheels/ or follow us on Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/mercanewheels/

Transboard's simple one-touch fold up system allows the scooter to be easily pulled behind you, much like carry-on luggage. It also makes it smaller for storage.


The Transboard is not only efficient, it's also a sexy looking machine. The outer shell is composed of polycarbonate, which is not only strong and absorbs external shock, it provides a high-gloss, sleek finish that fits in with it's smooth and stylish lines, much like the body of a high-end car.


Transboard is so much more than a safe and stylish way to ride. Transboard also delivers on performance.
Top speed of 22 MPH
Goes up to 25 miles on a single 6 hour charge
Why drive or take the bus to work in excruciatingly slow traffic when you can make your commute fun and fast with Transboard?    
Die-cast CNC process for a sturdy frame
Can carry up to 220 pounds safely, easily, and smoothly
Transboard's double wishbone suspension and rev-tricycle frame keep you more comfortable even over uneven terrain. The vehicle absorbs and adapts to flaws in your path to give you the best experience possible. The Transboard's LED screen displays speed, distance, power measurements, and other important functions. Using five buttons on the bottom of the display, you can power up your Transboard, set your trip distance, change the display mode, and so much more. It's easy to use and gives you the information you need quickly.We care about your safety as number one priority, Transboard has taillights during day/night time for your safe, yet, enjoyable ride.Our unique one-touch full-folding system makes it convenient to take your Transboard anywhere. Simply fold up with the touch of a button and pull like you would any kind of lightweight luggage. 
Light but mighty
Absorbs and resist the bumps and grinds of the road
Works with the suspension system to give you a smoother, safer ride
Because the Transboard has a detachable battery, it can be charged anywhere separately from the scooter itself -- perfect for those with a busy lifestyle. Want to go further with your Transboard?  Get our latest Perk, an additional 48V/4.3Ah Battery System allowing you to travel an additional 12.4 miles/20 km when the main battery needs charging. Located between the footpads, this battery is fits in perfectly and is easily detachable. This perk comes in either black or white and you will be able to select your desired color in a survey after the campaign. We know you'll want to keep your Transboard in motion, so having a couple of spare tires on hand is a smart way to plan ahead. These Two Extra Front Tires are our latest unlocked perk, thanks to our dedicated community of generous backers. Get them for 50% off ($50 off) before the campaign ends!  Our goal was to create the perfect riding experience that melded functionality, safety, and aesthetic design into something that everyone could use. But Transboard isn't just a leap forward in scooter technology, it's also a step forward for tech innovation and those who love it.Imagine yourself owning the world's most advanced 3-wheel scooter...Our design and development process had one simple goal: to maker a safer, sleeker scooter that could easily be used in different environments. Transboard is the culmination of our efforts: one of the most advanced and innovative 3-wheel scooters of our time. This is a giant leap forward not only in scooter technology, but in bringing the technology to a larger consumer base. We don't want to just develop cool things, we want to make sure that people like you have access to something truly efficient and safe.Do you ship worldwide?Yes, we ship to worldwide.  Please check the shipping fee for the country that you are in. If you have any further inquiries regarding shipping cost. Please let us know.Why are there shipping costs?Since we're offering the Transboard at such an extremely reduced rate for those who support our Indiegogo campaign, we have no margin to offer free shipping. Our goal is get you the lowest rate so you can experience the Transboard for yourself before they're released onto the market. We do not set the shipping fees and we present them to you without mark-up. Shipping costs are as follows:European Union:   $295United States:        $145Canada:                     $175Republic of Korea: $145Taiwan:                      $175China:                         $145Singapore:                $145Rest of the world:   $235Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT for International Orders?Import duty tax or VAT may need to be paid if your country requires it. –VATIs there a warranty on my Transboard?Yes. We offer six (6) months limited warranty on all Transboard purchases. All parts that are broken or defective due to manufacturers error are covered and will be shipped free of charge. Note: this does not include damages incurred by rider usage. Any alteration, tampering or modification of the electronics, battery, controller, throttle, motor, circuitry or related electrical wiring will not be serviced or supported by Transboard and will void the warranty.How long does it take to fully charge the battery?Approximately 6 hours with our standard charger if the battery pack is completely empty.Will the charger work in my country, and internationally?Yes. The chargers have an operating range of 110-220VAC, 50/60Hz, and covers most countries.Can the Transboard climb hills?Absolutely. The Transboard can climb hills up to 15 degrees.How long of a lifecycle does the battery have?Transboard uses a Li-ion battery, and it will last over 500 cycles. After 500 cycles, the performance of battery will start to decrease.What is the maximum weight to ride a Transboard?The Transboard has the best performance for hill climbing and full suspension capabilities bearing up to a maximum weight of 220lbs (100kg).What color choices do you offer?Currently we offer a black model and a white model.How do I get replacement parts?After the campaign ends, we will sell replacement parts online through our website where you can purchase components, accessories and even another Transboard. For rules on replacement parts due to manufacturers defect, see above.Where can Transboards be serviced?Transboards are designed to be simple enough for anyone to replace parts on their own. However, after the campaign, we plan on inviting A/S centers in major states to help us extend our repair and replacement services to the public.If I want to be a rep/distributor/retailer, where do I start?We are open to retailers worldwide. If you have a retail store where Transboard would be a good addition to your stock, inquire by emailing us at info@mercane.com.How can I contact you?You can email us anytime at info@mercane.com or like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/mercanewheels/ or follow us on Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/mercanewheels/

story:
In the post COVID world, bikes are more important than ever. Skip the bus or train, instead opting for a more healthy alternative. In EU countries, there are active subsidies that can be applied to our bikes. In most countries range from 250-500 EUR. 

Thanks to our revolutionary patented technology, you can charge your bike in only 20 minutes. Not 4 hours, not one hour. That's right, 20 minutes. 

Our Cambrian Battery has been patented and its intellectual property is strictly protected. 

Lab6 emerged from the most innovative city in the world - Tokyo. Short for Laboratory 6, Lab6 was created to develop and distribute products using the world's most innovative technology - carbon battery, "Cambrian™". 

 

 

 

Frackers produced by Laboratory6 in collaboration with Japan's oldest and most trusted bike manufacturer Maruishi. When 126 years of history meets the world’s first carbon battery the family bike of the future is created.  

(Maruishi Website: https://www.maruishi-cycle.com/)

Chari is a common type of bicycle popularized in Japan that is made for family use. Frackers supports three passengers (1 passenger and two children up to the age of 5-6 with seats and helmets), and uses our dock and lock™ system to ensure a smooth ride and optimal stabilization. You can use it for shopping, riding in the park or for deliveries.

　　　　　　　 

Ride in comfort and style with multiple passengers. Our patented stabilization technology ensures a smooth ride for everyone on board. The Bafang electric motor provides an extra boost to allow for the added weight of extra passengers. Our bike meets all safety standards ensuring a secure ride for everyone.. 

Removing the battery is intuitive, quick and easy. The Cambrian battery cell easily slides and lock into position and is easy to remove. Either plug directly into the bike, or remove the battery to charge.

 

Both of the chargers below are included with the purchase of a Frackers e-bike. You can choose to use either the SuperQuick Charger to fully charge in 20 minutes or the General Charger to charge in 4 hours.

Our bike battery promises a lifespan of over 10 years with over 10,000 lifecycles that is fully covered by our warranty. As our Carbon Battery Cambrian™  has a much better life cycle and safety level than Li-Ion, we have confidence that it won't cause a problem at least 10 years, which saves a lot of your cost to replace one in the future.  

The Bafang motor is extremely powerful at 240W which can assist riders when carrying heavy loads. The motor can accelerate the bike to a speed of 24 km/h (15 mph) which can be exceeded when pedalling. Frackers integrates the Shimano 3 speed gear system where the gear can be changed depending on incline and intended speed. 

Our Frackers bike is perfect for deliveries.  Frackers has a front basket for everyday goods including groceries and a rear carrying rack for packages up to 120kg (265lbs).

 

                               

Our patented kickstand is easy to set and release, even with the added weight of passengers or packages on board. To prevent falls and ensure maximum safety, the handles lock into a safe position once the kickstand is deployed.

Frackers' patented dock and lock system is vital when offloading or onloading passengers or goods.

Order now for 1199 USD! Be the first customer to experiece the worlds firstest charging! Our amazing Frackers bike, integrated with our QuickCharging™ technology that allows you to reach full charge in only 20 minutes. We offer a ten year warranty on our Cambrian™ battery, meaning that if you encounter any problems with our battery that it will be fully replaced, free of charge. 

All final designs of products may be subject to change, shipping and tax not included in final purchase price.

Front and rear child seat designed and manufactured by OGK, the top child seat manufacturer in Japan which has been established since 1982. Normally valued at $200, the OGK seat can be yours for only $120. Made in Japan for maximum quality, comfort and safety.

We proudly received the Tech Rocketship Award 2020 from the British Embassy of Tokyo in the category of Future of Mobility. We are working directly with the United Kingdom Department of International Trade on developing our bike in coordination with UK's smart city initiatives. 

We’ve built our team and product from the ground up, sporting the best battery technology on the market from Japan. Our team comes from strong, diverse professional backgrounds and is capable of delivering a killer bike that outdoes anything on the market.

 

 

We’re not only building a bike or a brand but rather planting the seeds for a vision of a sustainable carbon future with our backers. We’re constantly improving both the bikes and our own performance, listening to feedback intently.

In essence, our bikes are made by each one of you. Everyone who purchases a bike gives us feedback and cuts down on global emissions making a difference. Lab6 is creating a sustainable world: for everyone, built by everyone.



 Contact us at info@laboratory6.net

story:
Hello!

We are Shellock, a logistics Startup set-up in Barcelona. In May 2019, we met in the first maritime and blue logistics startup weekend, held in Barcelona by Techstars. Without knowing each other beforehand, we created the team and the idea of Shellock came up, after an intense and fun brainstorming session. The concept was so inspiring and enlightening, that motivated us to the point where we were working so synchronized that it felt like we had known each other since forever. We spent three days there from morning to night, shaping the concept, developing the business plan, researching for competitors and making the presentation. On the third day in a 5 minute-pitch, we presented Shellock before a jury integrated by high-rank professionals of the maritime and logistics industry and consolidated entrepreneurs. We placed second, it was huge emotion for the team, but we did not even know our lives were about to change. After the award ceremony, few managers from logistic enterprises approached to us, asking if we were going to make Shellock real. We looked at each other’s face with a smile, and said yes.

In January 2020 we partnered with the Universitat de Barcelona and we moved to its co-work space known as StartUb! In February, we started the Santander Incubation program “Explorer”. In April we were chosen for an acceleration program for maritime startups, which will be held in Haugesund, Norway and it's organized by Flow Maritime Accelerator, as you can see in the video.

In order to fulfill the dream of making Shellock real and disrupt the Shipping industry, we need your help. We are running this campaign to cover some expenses for the trip to Norway and to produce the first batch of Shellocks when we finished the program and have our product optimized. You won't be only helping us, you will be part of a big change in the world, helping to reduce the use of plastic and CO2 emissions in one of the biggest industries in the world.

What we need

We are raising 10,000 euros to cover the expenses of two months in Norway, our flight tickets, and the first batch of Shellocks. Considering that the living costs in Norway are high and we are a team of three, 10,000 is a tight budget but enough to sustain us during the program.

We are going to give nice t-shirts, mugs, and some accessories with our logo, nice collection series Shellocks and the space as sponsor on our website.

Challenge

This is a big but exciting challenge, we know we are on the right track. That is why this Accelerator has given us the opportunity to be part of this exclusive program, which aims for big things and changes. 

We have a unique team, full of heart, determination, and always willing to go the extra mile. We believe we are making something good for the planet and its life. 

Team:

CEO - Carlos Garces: Marine Engineer and Full Stack Developer, with wide experience in software and hardware testing for Mercedes-Benz.

CPO - Adolfo Calderon: Nautical Engineer in Navigation and Marine Transportation, with wide international experience working for Tidewater Martine and The Panama Canal.

CTO - Ferran Guasch: Mechanical Engineer, with experience as testing Engineer for Mercedes-Benz and skilled in hardware development.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can share this campaign on social media, with friends, family and people you know from the Shipping industry.

story:
The Inventors

Matthew Schafer and Kody Herchler both grew up on the west side of Cleveland, Ohio. Matthew is currently a sophomore in college at the University of Cincinnati studying Finance and Management. Kody recently graduated from the University of Cincinnati in Spring of 2014 with a Bachelor's Degree of Business Administration, specializing in Finance. 

The two aspiring entrepreneurs are actively seeking ways to help those around them. When Matthew came up with an idea to help prevent the immense issue of texting and driving, knowing distracted driving has become the leading cause of teen driver-related deaths, the two knew they had to pursue the idea.


The Idea

Their idea is to develop a mobile phone application they call "SafeDrive." The application automatically blocks predetermined notifications from the user's phone once the user exceeds 10 MPH, a program they call "SafeDrive Mode." There are two versions to the application; the Individual version and the Teen/Family version. The Individual version allows individuals to choose which settings will be blocked from their phone while in SafeDrive Mode. The Teen/Family version allows parents to choose the notifications that will be blocked from their teens' phones while the teen is in SafeDrive Mode. 

     

   

  

  


The Funds
Matthew and Kody are seeking funds to help them further their application's development. Thus far, they have had all of the pages of the application designed and developed, the blueprints for the functionality of the application created, as well as a website promoting the application. The two have also applied and received a provisional patent for their product. Lastly, they have purchased hundreds of keychains and T-shirts to help market the product. The two are seeking funds to help finance the final stage of the development for the application - the coding and programming of SafeDrive. This will launch the application to be onto the Android and iOS platforms. Contributors will help the two launch this life-saving application to help prevent distracted driving, the number one cause of teen-driving related deaths. By alleviating the temptation for driver's to use their phone while behind the wheel, SafeDrive will allow for a sound peace of mind while on the road.

The Uses
The $17,500 will drastically help the two with the final stage of application development, the launching process for SafeDrive, as the cost to code and program the application for the Android market will exceed $13,000. They will use the remainder of the generous contributions to help further their marketing strategies for the application, launch into the iOS market, finalizing the patent, and lastly, creating an LLC. If the entire goal is not reached, the funds will still contribute to these aspects of the launching process of SafeDrive.  
                   
The Inventors' History
Kody has previously worked in the development of an application through an intern position he held while in college. Both he and Matthew have the knowledge necessary to allow this application to succeed acquired from their college coursework, as well as from the help of their mentors. Although the two may encounter problems in the app market as they struggle to compete with other safe driving applications, they feel their specialized product will prevail as it differs from the rest with its automatic starting and user-friendly aspects. They are prepared to battle any challenges they may encounter. 

Thank You!
They greatly appreciate any generous contributions that may be made to help their launching of their safe driving application! They hope that this application can help drivers across the world be safer and more focused on the road, as it alleviates the temptation to use one's phone while driving.

story:
“Liderando el cambio en la movilidad urbana”; “Rompiendo con lo establecido”.

 

Un proyecto creado por jóvenes emprendedores para jóvenes aventureros.

 

Se podría decir que todo empezó por una casualidad: un cambio de localización, un viaje a California… Pero sobre todo, muchas caídas que se convirtieron en aprendizajes.

Fue un proyecto con muchas subidas y bajadas. Creamos un primer prototipo, y fuimos a  California a aprender, ya que su ecosistema emprendedor y su cultura del skate eran las más inspiradoras.

Después de comprobar que nuestro primer prototipo no podía competir en el mercado, dejamos de intentarlo y el proyecto quedó en un segundo plano.

Pero entonces, cambiaron nuestra sede de lugar, y  un trayecto que en un principio era de 2 minutos andando, se convirtió en 30 minutos de ida y 30 de vuelta cada día. Y nos dimos cuenta que necesitábamos una experiencia entretenida, cómoda y diferente, para hacer ese camino más emocionante.

En ese momento recuperamos las fuerzas, y las ganas de retomar el proyecto. Así que entramos en una fase de investigación y viajes en busca de un longboard eléctrico de buena calidad y asequible para todos los públicos.

 

Y por eso estamos hoy aquí, porque gracias a la inspiración, el esfuerzo y el luchar por un sueño, hemos conseguido sacar adelante un proyecto que en un principio parecía imposible.

 

¿Por qué Taupa? El nombre es una combinación de dos palabras que se identifican a la perfección con lo que quiere transmitir el producto. La primera palabra “Taupada”, es una palabra que proviene del euskera, nuestra lengua materna. Esta palabra significa latido, pulsación, ritmo.

La segunda palabra es “Teahupo”. Nombre de  una ola icónica de Tahití, muy conocida por los amantes del surf.  Y de estas dos palabras que transmiten ritmo y libertad surgió el nombre “Taupa”, con su lema “surfing the streets”.

Así que entramos en una fase de investigación y viajes en busca de un longboard eléctrico de buena calidad y asequible para todos los públicos. Y por eso estamos hoy aquí, porque gracias a la inspiración, el esfuerzo y el luchar por un sueño, hemos conseguido sacar adelante un proyecto que en un principio parecía imposible. ¿Por qué Taupa? El nombre es una combinación de dos palabras que se identifican a la perfección con lo que quiere transmitir el producto. La primera palabra “Taupada”, es una palabra que proviene del euskera, nuestra lengua materna. Esta palabra significa latido, pulsación, ritmo.
La segunda palabra es “Teahupo”. Nombre de  una ola icónica de Tahití, muy conocida por los amantes del surf.  Y de estas dos palabras que transmiten ritmo y libertad surgió el nombre “Taupa”, con su lema “surfing the streets”.

story:
Our Story

In June 2010 at Bellingham's World Naked Bike Ride event, Two people were arrested, Daniel Myers and Timothy Becker. Timothy was tackled off of his bike by Western Washington University police, and subsequently charged with assault of a law enforcement officer. Daniel objected to seeing Timothy shackled, hooded and forced inside a police cruiser naked and was charged with indecent exposure, obstruction of a law enforcement officer and resisting arrest after he .


The Naked Bike ride is a community organized event that brings people together to protest the policing of our bodies-- how we use them and when we show them. It is an act of defiance, celebration, and force. By riding as a mass we are creating a culture where everyone has the right to their own body. Our solidarity is our weapon. By standing together and opposing the charges these two people face, we are able to continue the spirit of liberation and freedom. Please show your support and solidarity with the defendants and your commitment to ending police brutality.

We are a team of community members seeking to support these defendants and help raise money to cover their legal fees.  They are facing jail time of up to ten years and need the support of the community.


Timothy Becker's Statement 

On the day of the Naked Bike Ride, which a few of my friends had collectively been organizing and looking to take part in, I was on the beach. I got a call from my previous partner about a half hour before it started, and she invited me to the bike ride. I had no intention of attending but, I was feeling good and happy, and the weather was really nice, so I decided to go. 


I rode my bike to the start point and arrived late, everyone was preparing to  leave. Just before we left it was passed through the crowd that we would have police escorts and the route was briefly discussed by the leaders and organizers. I took my shirt off, put it a friends' bag and started to follow the ride wearing only a sarong. My sarong was long and  fully covering me when we rode away from Forest Street. 


The ride went downtown and we passed several police along the route. The police appeared to go about their normal business and were seemingly disinterested with the event.  After downtown, we stopped at the Hub, my skirt was getting caught in my bike chain. The atmosphere was that of liberation but as I freed my skirt, I was shy and embarrassed about being naked. I didn't know what to do about my sarong being stuck. I told other riders about my problem and, they eagerly told me to keep it off and continue the ride naked. They were naked and I figured it was the best way to support them and solve my problem. I thought we could be proud of our bodies without fear of state or social repercussion, because we stood for a freedom of our own humanity. 


So as we were leaving the HUB, I took off my sarong and put it in my previous partners' rear bucket. We went toward Fairhaven on the permitted route with no police escorts as 60 or 70 naked people on all kinds of bikes would, silly, liberated and very, very, scared.  We went through Fairhaven and up the back side of the WWU campus. I wasn't even sure how we got there,  I never attended Western and don't understand the roads that surround campus very well and was very worried when we headed up there. I was naked and felt as though the safest plan was to continue with the group.


When we got to somewhere on WWU campus, by a large three-sided piece of alleged post-modern art, we were stopped by the WWu police.  I was near the back and am  fearful of the police and get very uncomfortable when they are present. I was so uncomfortable that I hid behind some of the largest riders praying the cops wouldn't see me. I heard some yelling about what way to go and I wasn't sure what was figured out amongst the police and organizers. All I wanted was to get dressed and go on with my day pretending it had never happened. I started to feel shitty and gross with the cop looking at all of us like we were criminals. 


I knew one way to a safe space on Forest Street, it was right down High street. I'm not a western student and didn't know when graduation was and I didn't fully understand the seriousness of obeying whatever had been set up by the police and organizers.  So I rode to the left side of the sculpture toward High street. A police officer got in my way and I tried to ride further to the left.  I didn't go fast enough so I was tackled by the police officer trying to get in my way. I was hurt and angry on the ground and the officer lifted my up both of my arms and threw me into a wall.


I said "Ok, now can i get dressed and go home?"  He cuffed me behind my back as tight as he could and wrenched the cuffs. I told him it was too tight and he told me I was being arrested for indecent exposure and resisting arrest. I asked him to let me get my clothes that were just in my bike bucket before we left, and he told me he wouldn't let me get dressed. I was scared and started to try and turn around to look the police officer. I was naked he was behind me and it made me really uncomfortable. 


I saw a tent down the way and someone riding off in the direction I was heading. It looked like there was an event on campus that day. I wondered if the tents were there to greet us as we rode in. The cop put me in the car and I wasn't being friendly. Another police officer showed up and they asked me if I would play nice. I said, "Yes, and I'd like you to kiss me," sarcastically. Then the police put a bag over my head. The police went into my bucket and got my wallet. They called in my ID. 


As the police drove me away through the mesh hood I saw people in dressed fancy and in suits. I saw a huge event in the PAC Theater. I was really confused. A loud burst came through the speaker and we parked behind the PAC. I waited in the car unattended for about a half hour. I could see the time on the dash. I was naked with a hood over my head in the back of a cop car while people walked by and looked in the window.  I tried to cross my legs and crunch up to hide myself, as people peered in a pointed at me some of them laughing.


I saw someone get dragged across the lawn and through the road asking why he has being detained and telling the police to stop hurting him.  They put him in a car ahead of me and we drove off.  The officer told me I was going to jail and what for. I told him I didn't understand and he said, "Good." I asked him to help me understand and he refused me any further information or any clarifying questions. 


When we got to the jail I was taken in with a police officer and jail guard.  My escorts stayed behind me. We stood in front of a window and a third guard took my property. I was wearing a bandanna around my neck and the guard who walked me in didn't like it. He said to the cop, "I can't believe you let him keep this on," and pulled hard at the knot choking me, he untied it.  I was scared of the amount of power they had over me and cursed them as they took off the hood. The guard then saw scars on my arm and pointed to them. He went out of the room, I waited until he brought back 5 more guards. He pointed my arm out to them and some of the new guards made remarks. Then they all took me to a shower room together tightly gripping my shoulders and made me spread my legs, lean over, and face the wall.  There was a bench in the room I asked if i could sit and the guards said no. They told me to stay there and made it clear I would be hurt if i turned to look at them, or sat down. I waited in the cold wet shower room, bent over, and threatened with violence if I moved or turned for about 10 minutes. Then a man came in. I never saw him, but he gave me clothes and told me I could turn around when I heard the door click. 


At first I was put in a cell alone, then Daniel Myers joined me and I learned he had been arrested while walking into his graduation he had a 500 dollar bail that was paid by his partner, and after a few hours he was released. I was denied bail at first and spent two days in jail until in court my bail was set to 1,500 dollars, and my charges changed from resisting arrest and indecent exposure to assaulting an officer. 


CHARGES:

Assault in the 3rd Degree (Assaulting an Officer)-- 2 counts


Daniel Myers Statement 


On Saturday, June 12, 2010, I awoke with some very specific intentions. For weeks I had been planning on partaking in the World Naked Bike Ride, followed by a ceremony for Huxley College graduates. After this, I had planned to begin riding by bicycle down to Mount Rainier National Park, where I was to work for the summer. Little did I know that the events wouldn’t follow their planned course.


We met up for the World Naked Bike Ride at approximately 11:30 at Forest and Cedar Park, down the hill from Western Washington University. Some folks were naked, while some wore underwear. Bodies were painted and smiles were worn. We rode in this fashion to celebrate the potential of human power. One person wore a sign that read “more nude, less crude”. For the years and months leading up to this event, through working on bicycles and riding them, I became more and more certain that bicycles are truly the pinnacle of modern technology. Machines more complex are more destructive and less interactive.


The riders were received by friendly pedestrians and motorists all throughout the ride. If I had to lay out a “Smile to Frown” ratio, we received somewhere around ten to fifteen smiles for every frown. Throughout Bellingham we had a good time, and were received well, not being bothered by the police throughout the city. However, the ride was not without some feelings of frustration. Throughout town, one of the organizers urged us to move to the side of the road in order to let cars by. I thought this invited an undue hazard to our group of 75 or so bicyclists. I felt like this was our time to hold the road, and that any motorist could wait five or so minutes for safety.


When we reached campus, the atmosphere changed dramatically. We came over a small hill near Carver Gym, and were met with hostility from the police officers, who demanded that we turn around and not disrupt the graduation ceremony. They shouted things like “turn around, freaks!” and “go home or get arrested”. We never intended to disrupt a ceremony, but rather to cultivate celebratory feelings. However, being met with this air of hostility, again the event organizers took the path of least resistance and urged everyone to turn around (similar to “get to the side and let the cars by”). At this point, after swallowing my frustrations throughout the ride, my fiery side came out, and I threw up a rally cry for anyone who wanted to ride on. As I recall, none of us were naked, so could not have been arrested for any crime. This is why I and a few of my close friends made an active decision to challenge the officers’ authority, and ride past them.


As I rode down a small hill below the officers at approximately 1:45, I heard a bike go down. Hearing this, I quickly put on some clothes that I had packed for the Huxley College Graduation Ceremony and returned to the scene to investigate (Before this point I had been wearing leopard-print panties). When I arrived, I saw my friend in a black hood in the back of their police car. This made me furious, and I promptly yelled insults and curses upon the officers who were now making an attempt to arrest me. At this point, I fled the scene and attempted to attend the Huxley College graduation ceremony, which meant a great deal to me because of the work I had put in.


Upon arriving at the doors, I saw a couple of officers talking to two friends of mine who had been engaged in the ride, and planned also to attend the ceremony (Danny McCoy and Fred Marshall). Not wanting them to get into trouble, I went up a flight of stairs to make sure I could hear what they were saying, so that they would not get into trouble for something they did not do. Then the chief of police of Western Washington University cornered me. His attitude was highly aggressive, he grabbed my wrists, and I attempted to free myself. Back-up arrived and he brought me to the ground. I yelled and screamed as they cut my backpack off of me, rendering it—for the time being—useless. Then I was dragged to a nearby police car, furious and yelling. They slammed my head on the hood of the car, and brought me downtown.


Charges

Obstruction of a Law Enforcement Officer

Indecent Exposure

Resisting Arrest

story:
Summary

HEAR IT FROM THE KIDS!  Youth in East San Jose want the East San Jose Bicycle Cooperative!


In a nutshell:

  • Cassidy and Adrian, two UCSC graduates and community advocates, are starting a nonprofit bicycle cooperative in East San Jose based around youth and community.
  • They will be partnering with after school spaces to teach elementary aged students about bike safety, and middle school aged students about bicycle mechanics and sustainability.
  • This space will give San Jose's at-risk youth a positive outlet to pursue a rewarding hobby while providing a safe and productive after school space for them to spend their time. 
  • Donations will fund tools, parts, and space for the middle school bicycle clinic, as well as bicycles and promotional material for the elementary school safety classes.
  • This is a grassroots organization that will rely upon your donation and social support to make it possible.

Facebook!  https://www.facebook.com/ESJbikecoop

Twitter! https://twitter.com/ESJBikes

Wordpress blog!http://esjbikecoop.wordpress.com/   

                      

            These two students from East San Jose want us to succeed and bring                   bikes and positive powers of bike culture to their community!


Read on to learn more about our project's ambitions, goals, details, ideas, and what you can do to help!


Two young men with a dream for a community...

The Founding Partners:  Cassidy Kakin has been spending the past year serving full time in the Alum Rock Union School District with City Year San Jose working in a middle school to increase student literacy and graduation rates.  He brings to the table his passion for the East San Jose community and a knowledge of non-profit fundraising and administration.  Adrian Baker-Kang has been spending the past two years of his life developing the mission and heading the operation of the University of California Bicycle Cooperative in Santa Cruz, CA.  He comes to this project with an extensive knowledge of how to run a small non-profit business centered around bicycles.  Both partners are recent graduates of the Politics program at UCSC, and have worked hard to understand the realities of low income communities and  the ways in which bicycles can improve the situations of underprivileged individuals.  

Cassidy and Adrian with their first official donation bike

Miguel, a student volunteer, changing his tube at the UCSC Bike Coop, a nonprofit student-run organization which Adrian has co-owned for the past year and a half

Stepping ahead of a growing issue, for the sake of at risk youth...

The Social Problem: San Jose is a changing and modernizing city of a million, devoted to the expansion of bicycle infrastructure.  Within the next decade, high traffic major bicycle lanes will be extended from the down-town region into the low-income suburban area of East San Jose, allowing for an all new, cheap and accessible option for exploring the urban landscape.  Without a doubt, youth in East San Jose will be taking advantage of this opportunity to get more out of their world and see the beauty of their city.

However, this increased bike-ability of San Jose could come with an unsavory cost, especially to youth.  Currently, San Jose has the highest rate of bicycle related fatalities of any city in the Bay Area.  2013 was the deadliest year for bikers in San Jose in almost two decades.  If the infrastructure necessary to increase bike transportation rates in San Jose continues to be constructed and expanded as the city plans, rates of bike related fatality and injury will very likely increase as well.  These increases are especially likely to be centered among youth, who are susceptible to major injuries from bike/auto collisions and are generally not as knowledgeable of safe biking practices.  That is, unless something is done now.

We plan to bring bike safety and positive bike culture to East San Jose.  We plan to work in schools through partnerships with established after school programs to introduce elementary aged students to safe bike practices.  We plan to bring hands on mechanical knowledge and bike maintenance experience to middle school students through mobile repair clinics.  We plan to insure that increased access to bicycle infrastructure does not lead to increased youth bicycle related injury and death in the East San Jose community.  We plan to work as a community outreach organization to promote positive bike culture in an underprivileged neighborhood, involving East San Jose's youth in a productive and rewarding hobby that has the potential to change their life and better their world.  By donating to our project, you can help get these plans in motion.  

The UCSC Bike Coop was founded in 1994 and helps on average fifty to one hundred students per day learn how to repair their bicycles in a friendly, safe, environment. 

How are we different?

There are non-profits and projects with similar goals in downtown and West San Jose, but such services are limited  in East San Jose. Large-scale bicycle safety classes are nearly nonexistent in this part of the city, especially in the capacity that we will be offering.  Maintenance clinics like the ones our model will offer are entirely original in the area.  By creating long term partnerships with schools and forming relationships with the students we work with, we will promote bike culture in a positive manner that monthly or yearly safety clinics are unable to do.  We will work in in a holistic and informed manner focused on community interaction, with the capacity to deliver a uniquely tailored service to fulfill the yet to be addressed needs of young cyclists throughout the area.

From adjusting brakes to rebuilding hubs, we have experience in both repairing bikes as well as helping others learn how to work on theirs


What We Need & What You Get

Start-up Capital

The vast majority of your donation will go towards investing in physical start-up capital.  We intend to have two fully operational thrusts under our project's umbrella: safety clinics to be delivered in elementary schools, and maintenance clinics to be operated in middle schools.  To get both these projects off the ground, we will need:

  • A small "safety fleet" of bikes, appropriately sized for elementary school students grades 3-5.
  • Two canopy tents, for our mobile maintenance clinics.
  • One set of professional quality bicycle tools, for adult use.
  • Several sets of introductory level tools for student use.
  • Several portable bike repair stands.
  • Several higher capital tools, like a truing stand and a portable vice.
  • Several miscellaneous bike maintenance tools, like tire levers.
  • A large quantity of basic repair parts like tubes and brake pads, for maintenance of our "safety fleet" and provision of free or cheap parts for middle school maintenance clinics.
  • Cool gifts and gear to give to students to increase interest in our project and promote bicycle culture such as bells and lights.

Some of our volunteers at the UCSC Bike Coop getting ready to go on a ride after a day in the shop helping other students

Operational Expenses and "Wish List" items

Any donations above and beyond those required to cover our significant start-up costs will be either a. set aside to cover operational expenses, as many of the materials we will buy like bike parts and cheap tools will need to be replaced down the road, or b. put towards our "wish-list."  We have several integral "wish-list" items that would make our project much more feasible and more effective, like a small trailer to transport materials to different sites, and larger prizes to raffle off to students in order to promote our project and raise awareness of bicycle safety.  We expect the majority of funds raised to go directly to start-up costs, but will insure that any donations above and beyond those we are asking for are spent on the important components of our project mentioned above.  Conversely, if we do not reach our entire funding goal, we will be prioritizing our "safety fleet" and basic tools, with gifts to raise student interest and more capital intensive tools being placed on lower priority.  


Adrian facilitating a discussion on the importance of sustainable transportation options for low-income communities 

Where your money won't go?

Our pockets.  We intend to make this project a full time commitment, and we are pursuing grants and other funding sources to make that economically possible for the project founders.  No money from your donation will go towards personal expenses of those associated with the project.  

Adrian and Cassidy working on bikes in the UCSC Bike Coop

"Perks, you say?!?"

Good things come to those who show support!  For 75 or 150 dollars, you will get some branded East San Jose Bicycle Cooperative Swag!  For only 100 dollars, a professional bicycle mechanic will sit down with your ride and get it running the best it has ever run (shipping costs and large materials/big ticket supply cost not included).  For 250 dollars, you will be sent a "life-time membership" badge, giving you free use of our tools, consultation with our expertise, and discounts through our ordering channels for the life-time duration of our project.  For 350 dollars, we will bike around San Jose with you for a day, sharing our knowledge of the city and its unique bike culture.  For 500 dollars, you will get "Founding Donor" status, getting your name on our t-shirts and all the perks of life-time membership.  For 2000 we will build you a custom fixed or single speed bike, branded with our project and signed by us, with paint and part preferences accommodated if possible.  And for every 500 you donate, you will be awarded 1 raffle ticket entered into a drawing to win a premium custom fixed gear or single speed bike built, signed, and branded by the founders.  There are a lot of unique perks to be had for the generous!


The Impact

  

          This student believes that bikes can change her life and her world for the            better. "When I bike, I feel like I'm free, as if nothing can bother me, as if             all the worries have gone away."

A community in need...

East San Jose is a beautiful and unique community, with strong ties to the diverse Mexican, Chicano, Latino, Vietnamese, Filipino, Cambodian, and Pacific Islander cultures, as well as the many other tight knit ethnic communities, that call the area home.  In recent decades, the area has been mired with poverty: more than 80% of students qualify for free or reduced lunch, putting them below the poverty line.  Additionally, gang activity in the area can make students fear for their safety, creating a less than desirable climate for those hoping to do their best.  Despite these economic and social challenges, East San Jose is a strong community of close families, devoted workers who struggle tirelessly, and students with many opportunities at their fingertips and success within their reach.  This is the community we would like to serve.

Adrian adjusting brakes at the UCSC Bike Coop

The nuts and bolts of our service...

In essence, our project has three primary ambitions: increasing awareness in  youth of safe bike practices, increasing exposure of youth to basic bicycle mechanics, and promoting positive bicycle culture in the community.

Our safety clinics would be the largest thrust of our project, and would target primarily elementary school aged students.  From a central location, we would transport our "safety fleet" to a partnered elementary school once or twice a month on a scheduled rotation, and lead bike safety workshops for interested students.  These workshops would take place in existing established after school programs, like the City Year program Cassidy has worked with this past year.  Working in the after school space would give Cassidy and Adrian a large degree of flexibility to write programs designed specifically around the needs of the students involved, delivering a fine tuned product to an existing audience.  Bike safety clinics would start with introductions of necessary skills, and would move from week to week into an exploration of bicycle laws and best practices, culminating in bike ride field trips where students could test their skills in the real world under close supervision.  

Our maintenance clinics would be targeted at a middle school audience.  Once a week at each middle school we partnered with, we would set up a mobile bike shop, with tents and tools and bike repair stands on display for student use.  These clinics would take place in the after school space as well, and would allow Cassidy and Adrian to work hands on with students in a one on one and small group setting, instructing middle schoolers about safe tool use practices and basic mechanics.  Working with the middle school grade levels would allow for a more thorough exploration of the mechanical side of bicycles, giving students exposure to an interesting, useful, and potentially profitable skill set.  Our interactions with middle schoolers would be centered around bike safety as well; in order to work hands on in our shops, students would first have to pass a bike safety quiz to prove they are ready to ride safely.  

Both our safety and maintenance clinics would contribute to our larger and more abstract goal of promoting positive bike culture in the community.  Across the world, increased use of bicycles as a primary means of transportation has proven to increase the fortunes of those in low income communities by lowering transportation expenses overall, lowering health care expenses by promoting a healthy lifestyle, and mitigating environmental and urban planning concerns by de-congesting clogged roadways.  By promoting bike use to youth, and exposing youth to a productive and rewarding hobby that draws interest away from illegal activity and can serve as a unique means of enriching their life, we hope to serve the community more generally.  We hope that spreading bike culture will contribute to an empowered and uplifted East San Jose community at large. 

Bringing the community together on Bike to Work day, free breakfast being provided by the UCSC Bike Coop.

A bit more about the founders...

Cassidy Kakin grew up riding bikes in Northwestern Montana before moving to the Bay Area in middle school.  His childhood and adolescence were defined by abject poverty, and he has kept this experience close to heart as he has explored the issues of poverty and under-privileged communities through the study of Politics at the University of California, Santa Cruz.  In high school, he worked as a grant writing intern at a community based non-profit in his home town, and saw first hand the impact that a non-profit that is in tune with the community it serves can have.  For the past year he has been dedicated to a year of service, employed with City Year San Jose in the Alum Rock School District in East San Jose.  On the daily he tutors 7th graders, helps run an after school program, and tries his best to be a role model for youth.  He hopes to leverage and learn from the connections he has made in the Sillicon Valley non-profit world, the Alum Rock School District, and the youth community of the East Side in order to effectively manage this project next year.  He also bikes to work, and always wears a helmet.  

Adrian Baker-Kang is currently finishing up his final year at the University of California, Santa Cruz, with a degree in Politics expected in the summer of 2014.  He is an avid cyclist, backpacker, and traveler who has experienced first hand the benefits that bicycle culture can have in low income communities around the world.  For the past two years he has run the UC Santa Cruz on-campus bicycle cooperative.  During this time he has worked daily to promote bicycles as a permanent transportation solution by teaching fellow students the mechanical skills necessary to work on their own bikes. In addition, he spent a year volunteering with the Santa Cruz Bike Church, a nonprofit community-based organization that provides mechanical assistance to low-income families in downtown Santa Cruz.  It is his dream to pursue a career focused on designing sustainable methods of transit for both rural and urban communities around the world. If he's not building a bike, he's probably out riding one, always with a helmet of course.

Facebook!  https://www.facebook.com/ESJbikecoop

Twitter! https://twitter.com/ESJBikes 

Wordpress blog!http://esjbikecoop.wordpress.com/  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, we understand.  There are plenty of other ways to get involved.

MOST IMPORTANTLY, Share this project with all of your friends, especially those interested in social justice, education, sustainability, and bicycles.  

ALSO, feel free to contact us with any in-kind expertise you have, or any ability you have to donate time and labor, as a helping hand will not go unappreciated during our next few start-up months.  

And ALWAYS: bike safe, bike often.  


Thanks for your time and support!

--Cassidy Kakin and Adrian Baker-Kang

Cassidy and Adrian, two UCSC graduates and community advocates, are starting a nonprofit bicycle cooperative in East San Jose based around youth and community.
They will be partnering with after school spaces to teach elementary aged students about bike safety, and middle school aged students about bicycle mechanics and sustainability.
This space will give San Jose's at-risk youth a positive outlet to pursue a rewarding hobby while providing a safe and productive after school space for them to spend their time. 

Donations will fund tools, parts, and space for the middle school bicycle clinic, as well as bicycles and promotional material for the elementary school safety classes.
This is a grassroots organization that will rely upon your donation and social support to make it possible.

story:
Who am I?


I am Janet and I am a refugee advocate.  I believe in helping others who need our help and this young man really needs our help.  He fled certain persecution and is from one of the most persecuted minorities in the world.  So little from us could mean so very much to him... 


What We Need & What You Get

All monies will go towards:
1. Electric Bike/Scooter and any equipment needed

2. Travel, accommodation and expenses for Dollah to visit his wife and daughter who he has not seen in 6 years!

3. Supporting his wife, daughter and extended family.

You get the extreme satisfaction of helping a generous, compassionate, resilient and honest human being.


Why should we help him?

Dollah is currently being shunned and threatened in the Australian country town where he lives and works.  He is frightened to continue to walk the long way home each day along country roads late at night. An electric bike would solve this problem....

But he is even more deserving.  This week he found a large sum of money, money that he could have used for himself or for his family who depend upon him in order to be able to buy rice and water. However, he did not keep this money.  Dollah is a proud and noble young man.  He contacted the police who collected it from him.  This young man has faced hardships we can barely imagine and yet he did not give handing in the money a second thought.  Simply stating "It is not mine." Our country is the nobler for having him here amongst us and we should be able to help in in his time of need.

This wonderful young man carries heavily the weight of supporting his family who fled their Asian country. Like many others of his well-documented and internationally recognised persecuted ethnic minority, their house and all their possessions were burned down and destroyed by those that persecute them.... The Australian Government has refused his young wife and little girl humanitarian visas, stating they weren't persecuted ENOUGH to qualify. (His little girl was living under a tarp with no regular food as people were being massacred around them... and this is not considered persecuted enough.) He longs to see them, and despite never having gone to school or being able to read or write, he found a job after 18 months of non-stop trying. He has no chance of getting a licence without English, so an electric bike would greatly help him overcome his fear of the long dark walk home late at night after he finishes work... C'mon people - we can do this.

story:
Improving human life with a superior technology, a stunning versatility and an exquisite Italian style.


TRILIX in the Latin language means truss, and for the ancient Romans it meant canvas strand: the weft of three intertwined strands guaranteed a great strength. By the time, the term “ truss 3 D” was adopted by the mechanic industry to point the recursive structure of three elements. In the motorbike industry the space frames are linked to the purest Italian tradition, to which TRILIX belongs.

 

TRILIX IS THE TRIPLE THREAT
FOLDABLE PLAYER OF YOUR LIFE 

 
 

1. Luxury Italian Design

We designed an Aluminum Space frame in its purest Italian form to offer agility, efficiency, durability and comfort. This type of frame ensures accurate wheel tracking for secure road holding and cornering stability. It is far superior to a conventional bicycle frame and it’s been studied for universal use, real performance and comfort.

2. High Technology

High Density LG Lithium battery  21700 36V 15 Ah,  has an extraordinary range of 120 km (75 Mph), turning TRILIX into the perfect commuting/urban mobility transport as well as the best outdoor companion for weekend rides.

We equipped TRILIX with

  • Mid-drive assisted pedaling Bofeili motor with torque sensor for a natural cycling and the best weight-positioning
  • TRILIX is available in two versions: the smooth and comfy 250W, limited speed 25Km/h (around 15Mph), fitting most EU countries road regulations and the more powerful and sporty 500W, limited speed 32Km/h (around 20Mph), fitting most of the US countries road regulations. 
    Whatever choice you make, after reading the user manual, ride carefully respecting the road regulations of the country you live in. 
  • ​3 gears wide range internal gear hub, optimizing 150% gear ratio maintenance free

  • 16” plus tires, the new size for the urban commuters or 20” 2.0 tires as an option without extra-charge, to enjoy exploring new roads.

3. Ride Versatility

TRILIX was born to be the most versatile transport and all-round performer. The same bicycle can be dressed for travel or stripped for action as required: thanks to its ergonomics and accessories, TRILIX turns into everyone’s complementary life tool.

From the Urban hustle and bustle into the traffic free countryside

 

FOLDING TECHNOLOGY

TRILIX’s folding mechanism is easy, sturdy and safe. Once the e-bike is folded through our Double safety folding system, it remains stiff and stable, making your commuting experience fluid and enjoyable. Thanks to its built in spinner wheels it can be easily pushed around making it the ideal bike to assist your everyday life.

 

ABSORPTION SYSTEM

TRILIX brings full-suspension comfort to all kinds of terrain - paths, trails, tracks and gravel roads. The suspended seat post and the single shock fork are designed to stick your tires to the ground for the maximum efficiency and safety, as well as absorbing shocks from bumps and dips in the trail.

TRILIX is available with a variety of accessories and add-ons which make it perfect to meet everyone’s needs and passions. The configurations are:

  • CLASSIC for those who focus on essentiality and lightness;
  • TECNO for those who believe in the utility of the digital technology;
  • PRATICA for those who privilege a practical vehicle to ride.

 

 

CLASSIC EARLY BIRD

 

TECNO EARLY BIRD

 

PRATICA EARLY BIRD

 

TRILIX COLORS

TRILIX foldable e-bike colors are Powder Coating to offer high quality and durable finish. Right now there are three colors available.

 

ACCESSORIES

  • one touch quick release* system for all the accessories
  • Italian made frame bag* to protect your battery providing an extra storage you need
  • Front rack*, size matter if you need extra space to carry your bags
  • Padded thermic front bag*, to maintain your grocery at the right temperature
  • Rear rack *when you need to carry more
  • Rear view camera* for a perfect day and night vision
  • Water proof IP 68 Bluetooth speaker* for your calls and to enjoy your music away from home
  • Front and rear Spanninga led lights* to brighten your everyday life
  • Aluminum water bottle 750 cl* with reflex thermo-adhesive, to stay hydrated throughout the day.
  • Cup holder* made in 600 with reflex thermo-adhesive, to carry liquids while you are riding.
  • Direction lights* to improve your visibility

* standard or available as an option, depending on the model

 

YOU CAN TRUST US

TRILIX is a Moto Parilla project created by an Italian company with years of experience in designing motorbikes and electric bikes of the future.  Moto Parilla is well known for the Carbon e-bike, an extraordinary vehicle that deserved a place in the ADI (Italian association for industrial design) Design Index Book 2019. In fact Italian creativity is popular all over the world for its high quality content, painstaking attention to details.

WARRANTY: the Warranty of the product takes up right after the purchase of the e-bike and it lasts 2 years, starting from the invoice date.
The motor and battery warranty period lasts 2 years and it starts from the invoice date.
The warranty covers all the mechanic parts, the replacement or the fixing of a defective e-bike only, excluding the operating costs such as shipments,  manpower, returns and so on. 
The warranty does not cover damages due to the shipment, or materials subject to deterioration, such as tires or brake pads.  
This warranty is not transferable in any way and may not be exercised by anyone other than the original retail buyer.
NO REFUNDS WILL BE MADE AFTER THE CAMPAIGN ENDS.

TRILIX respects the best safety standards and complies with the International regulations.

The common denominators of Moto Parilla projects are the high quality achieved by the “Made in Italy” and the best technology.

 

WE ARE ON PRODUCTION

 

TRILIX IN ACTION

 
 
 


PRODUCTION IN ACTION
 








 

 

BEHIND THE SCENES - MEET THE TEAM

 

 

 

SHIPPING 

We can also offer worldwide shipment, get in touch with us for your need.
info.trilix@motoparilla.it


REFUND POLICY

We are subject to Indiegogo's refund policy. Click here to read more about refunds.
No refunds are available after a product has been shipped.

 

FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA
 

                                                   

 

There may be some changes, modifications or improvements in the  version which will be shipping to all backers. 
We will keep you informed for any other products releated news

By the time, the term “ truss 3 D” was adopted by the mechanic industry to point the recursive structure of three elements. In the motorbike industry the space frames are linked to the purest Italian tradition, to which TRILIX belongs. TRILIX IS THE TRIPLE THREATFOLDABLE PLAYER OF YOUR LIFE

story:
We are an all-electric vanpool provider in California and the first company to combine vanpooling, car sharing and fleet replacement. This means we can make a greater environmental impact by maximizing the use of our zero-emission fleet. 
Current vanpool commutes are inefficient. The vans are only used about 6-9% of the week, and just parked the rest of the time. On top of that, standard vanpool vehicles operate on conventional, petroleum fuel and have poor fuel economy. We've developed a new model that utilizes the vanpool vehicle during a substantial portion of the remaining 91-94% of the time as a public car share vehicle or to replace an employer’s fleet vehicle. By doing so, the efficiency between the systems increases the environmental benefits and reduces the costs, allowing us to offer our services at an affordable rate. 

We will be launching with the premium all-electric, seven-passenger Tesla Model X, the only vehicle in the US market that meets the needs of Green Commuter’s unique and synergistic model. 




Help us meet our goal of $100,000 to catalyze cheaper and greener commuting and mobility in Los Angeles! All your contributions will go toward building our fleet. Once we launch, and after you've completed your Green Commuter profile, you will be able to enjoy exclusive car share use of our state-of-the-art, all-electric Tesla Model X fleet through whatever perk option fits your lifestyle. Even if we don't reach our entire goal, your perk will still be redeemable! We're offering up to 70% off our Tesla Model X Car Sharing packages for weekdays and weekends.


Once we launch, you'll be able to rent our all-electric vehicles by the hour, day or weekend from our website, phone or iOS and Android Apps. Our vehicles will be spread throughout Los Angeles. Just make a reservation and unlock the vehicle with your smartphone.









We are committed to using the safest and most environmentally friendly vehicles available to us. The Tesla Model X is the only vehicle in the US market that meets the needs of Green Commuter’s unique and synergistic model. With the seating capacity for seven passengers and the battery range required for vanpool commutes and daily car sharing, this premium vehicle is also plenty appealing with internet and features galore for vanpoolers and individual car share members like you!

Not only will your contribution allow you to experience the Tesla Model X at a steeply discounted rate, but in so doing, you’re contributing to something much bigger, a new way for Angelenos to commute and get around! Let’s all share the ride in a Tesla Model X.

Increasing the use of zero-emission vehicles in the US is an issue that many stakeholders – from industry players to regulatory agencies - are trying to tackle through policy change, incentive-based programs and other strategies. Our approach to overcoming the perceived uncertainty of electric vehicles (like all those questions about battery life…) is to recruit new electric vehicle drivers!  We will be successful by making this classy fleet available to more people, specifically drivers from all socioeconomic backgrounds. At the end of the day, car sharing provides an affordable solution for low-to-middle income families and residents who do not own a car or need a second car for specific trips.  That’s the beauty of our solution.

We also address concerns about the availability of electric vehicle charging stations by offering our own turnkey electric vehicle station equipment services. (Yep! This additional service includes initial site consultation, construction management and networking assistance).  We all want to see more on- and off-street charging stations at public locations where car share vehicles will be parked. An exciting development on this front is the City of Los Angeles has installed over 1,000 publicly-available electric vehicle charging stations to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and encourage adoption of plug-in vehicles citywide.

We recognize that most drivers are “in the dark” about the basic characteristics of driving an electric vehicle.  To them we say: You don’t know what you are missing!  Several great agencies, including the amazing nonprofit organizations Adopt-A-Charger and the Charge-Ahead Coalition, do powerful work to educate people about the efficiencies and public health benefits of low and zero-emissions vehicles. We are grateful for those efforts. For our part, Green Commuter will be taking the lead in Los Angeles by making electric vehicles attractive and accessible to mainstream consumers. Makes you feel good, doesn’t it?

If now isn’t the time to contribute to our campaign, perhaps instead of sharing the ride, we could ask you to SHARE? Or you drank the Kool-Aid and already got your perk, what’s next? 

Please help us get the word out! Sharing a genuine post about what we are doing is so important!

Like us at @GreenCommuterInc on Facebook
Follow us at @gogreencommuter on Twitter
Follow us at GreenCommuterInc on Instagram

PEOPLE – PROFIT – PLANET. We are a minority-woman-owned small business and benefit corporation looking to make a big change in how people commute. With an innovative model, creative technology and the determination to make an impact, Green Commuter is committed to providing affordable, zero-emissions commuting and mobility options to Californians to reduce traffic, commuting costs, and greenhouse gas emissions. As a benefit corporation and social enterprise, instead of having the responsibility to our stakeholders to make decisions purely based on their financial impact, we choose to consider our social and environmental impact, too. Green is right there in our name. We also believe in social justice and are committed to keeping costs manageable and EV technology available to people of all income levels.


For a list of Frequently Asked Questions, please visit our Help section at greencommuter.org
If you have any specific questions, please feel free to contact us at contact@greencommuter.org
