story:
Our 2016 Electric Bike Models

All Go Specs & Features

The M2S Bikes All Go is a carbon fiber electric bike designed with a hidden battery and powerful mid drive motor linked up to a 27-speed drive-train to serve up tons of power to conquer any hill, yet feels like a high performance street machine when you decide to switch it off. Packed with 650 watts of peak power, the All-Go travels up to 50 miles on a single charge, while the integrated LCD screen command center allows you to monitor key stats while riding. The removable battery charges in 4 hours and fits sleekly right into the bike’s frame.

  • Mid-Drive torque sensing 250 watt motor capable of producing 650 watts of peak power directly to the drive-train to make climbing hills and maintaining speed easier than ever.
  • Carbon Fiber frame makes this one of the lightest electric bikes currently on the market. At only 33 pounds, this bike is quick and nimble making it a joy to ride whether using the electric pedal assist or without.
  • The 27-speed Shimano Alivio drive-train makes it easy to maximize pedal efficiency on the climbs, while having enough range to power you through the flats to easily reach speeds of 30 m.p.h.
  • Hydraulic disc brakes with motor cut off ensure that it's easy to stop the bike quickly and safely.
  • Integrated digital display makes it easy to view key statistics while you ride, including speed, watts, battery power, temperature and trip distance.

About Our Carbon Fiber Electric Bike

The carbon fiber frame of the M2S Bikes All Go carbon fiber electric bike is complimented by a powerful mid drive motor with torque sensing technology to provide a smooth and enjoyable ride. The high end components found on this bike combine to provide a unique offering designed to provide maximum value and longevity. The bike frames and motors are manufactured in Asia, while the individual components will be installed and tested at our facility in Asheville, NC. We are committed to providing the highest customer service and quality with our bikes and are offering a two-year warranty on the frame, motor and electronic components. 

In addition to offering the standard model with carbon fiber fork and integrated digital display, we are also offering the option to upgrade to a 100mm RockShox XC30 suspension fork.

In The News

  • Ubergizmo: Most of the time, when we talk about electric bikes, it would have something to do with a rather heavy or clunky frame complete with a large battery which looks unwieldy. This particular crowdfunding project that has just launched – the M2S All-Go electric bike, will certainly hope to change the way in which one looks as an electric bike, since it boasts of a carbon frame that delivers not only distinct looks, but also a light ride weight, now how about that for being practical?
  • Autoevolution: Enter M2S All-Go, a new lightweight ebike that also looks good while packing enough features to make you think twice about taking that car out of your garage for commuting on a fair day.
  • Gizmag: Just a few years ago, "weird" and "heavy" were two adjectives that were nearly unavoidable when discussing e-bikes. Things have started to rapidly change over the past few years, with a number of companies stepping up and offering lighter, less conspicuous electric bikes. The M2S All-Go is the latest in this growing field, its carbon frame offering both distinct looks and a light ride weight. 
  • Tasty Tech Eye Candy of the Week: LIGHTWEIGHT ELECTRIC BIKE Electric bikes don't have to weigh a ton. The All-Go from M2S is made with a carbon-fiber frame and weighs 33 pounds. A 500-watt pedal-assist electric drive gets you going up to 28 mph.

General Overview Of The M2S Bikes All Go Carbon Fiber Electric Bike

Electric bikes are quickly changing the way people think about cycling. No longer do hills and tough climbs have to stand in the way between you and where you want to be. But as much fun as most of the electric bikes currently on the market can be, they are often very heavy, which makes carrying them up stairs, loading them onto a bike rack or pedaling them home once the battery dies not a whole lot of fun for anyone. But starting now, that's about to change thanks to the All-Go, our revolutionary new carbon fiber electric bike. 

Weighing in under 40 pounds with the battery, the All-Go is an electric bike that feels and rides like a normal bike and allows riders to easily switch between pedal assist modes to take advantage of a powerful mid drive motor that produces up to 650 watts of peak power to give an extra boost to make climbing hills easier than ever before. On the flats, riders can choose to take advantage of extra power to battle headwinds or maintain speeds of up to 28 m.p.h. with ease, or with the push of a button, switch to pedal-only mode and maximize your ride time while enjoying the lightweight efficiency and the effective 27-speed drive-train.

One of the key features of this bike is the revolutionary mid drive motor that allows the power to be applied where need it most: the pedals. The centered weight and ability to deliver over 600 watts of peak power keep this bike feeling agile and fun on all types of terrain. The integrated digital display provides key statistics while you ride, including speed, watts, battery power, temperature and trip distance. At just over 33 pounds including battery, this bike was made to fly thanks in large part to the stiff carbon fiber frame that provides incredible strength at a fraction of the weight of many other electric bikes. Climbing hills and bombing the descents has never been easier or more fun. The 27 speeds make it easy to maximize pedal efficiency on the climbs, while having enough range to power you through the flats to easily reach speeds of 30 m.p.h. Thanks to the power and reliability of the mechanical disc brakes, stopping is quick and easy. Lightweight, but long-lasting Lithium Ion provides around 30 miles of pedal assist power (depending on various factors this time could be longer or shorter). The 36 volt, 11 amp hour battery features Samsung cells and is backed by a one year warranty and will deliver over 800 battery cycles.

All Terrain Electric Fat Bike

We spent two years working to come up with what we believe is the best electric fat bike on the market at the most affordable price point possible. With best in class options like the 750 watt motor and 17 amp hour battery, this electric fat bike is capable of extra long rides and has plenty of power to blast up the steepest hills. If you're in the market for an electric fat bike, we believe you'll find that our specs beat out the competition regardless of price... it just so happens we not only have the best electric fat bike on the market, it's also one of the most affordable.

The M2S Bikes All Terrain electric fat bike is ready for pretty much everything you can throw at it. From deep sand to fresh snow and everything in between, this bike has everything you need to get you where you want to go. The rugged aluminum alloy frame includes an integrated battery pack capable of delivering over 50 miles per charge using pedal assist or around 20 miles on throttle-only mode. The 4.5 inch fat tires easily cruise through the toughest terrain while absorbing bumps and soaking up holes with ease. 

Standard Features On The All Terrain:

  • Powerful and reliable Bafang motor with two-year warranty
  • Panasonic 17 amp hour lithium ion batteries rated for 900+ charge cycles
  • Durable high-quality aluminum alloy frames
  • Tektro hydraulic disc brakes with motor cut off
  • Zoom handlebar and stem
  • Shimano 1x8 gear set and derailleur
  • Aluminum Alloy rims with extra-large tires (26” x 4.5")
  • Stem-Mounted LCD display
  • Multi-function control with thumb throttle
  • Choice of white or black paint
  • Smart battery charger system
  • Aluminum alloy pedals
  • Two-year warranty
  • Optional RST Renegade suspension fork 

About M2S Bikes

M2S Bikes was founded in 2015 with the goal of bringing affordable, yet high quality electric bikes to the market. Our mission is simple: help facilitate travel via bikes for those times when you’re not necessarily wanting to get in a workout, but simply are looking for a way to get to work, head to the farmer’s market or go out for a fun joy ride without breaking a sweat.

In 2016 we launched our first two models, a carbon fiber electric bike and an electric fat bike. Both bikes were initially funded through crowdfunding campaigns and raised over $95,000 in pre-orders. Thanks to our early supporters we’ve been able to get our manufacturing process up and running and will begin delivery of our first two models to our pre-order customers beginning in November 2016.

WE STAND BEHIND OUR BIKES

Thanks to our industry-leading two-year warranty on our motors, frames and batteries, you don’t have to worry about what to do in the event something goes wrong with your bike. We’ve got your back and we’ll continue to offer great customer service and support long after the two year warranty period is up.

ADVENTURE IS WHAT WE DO

Outdoor adventure and exploration is what we’re all about. For that reason, over the next few months we’re excited to continue to innovate and will be offering optional accessories to help you get the most out of your bike and allow you to take on even bigger adventures. Whether you need a trailer for heading down to the beach or heading out into the backcountry for an overnight camping expedition, our accessories are designed to make using your bike for epic adventures fun and easy.

OUR SUPPORT IS THE BEST

Not only do we stand behind our bikes with a two-year warranty, we’re also here to help you with the little things that happen along the way. Whether you need assistance assembling your bike, re-configuring the digital display or finding a local bike shop to help service your bike, we’re here to help. We’ll be rolling out a series of How To videos over the next few months highlighting many of the questions our customers have about assembly, changing the controls and maintenance.

What's Next For M2S Bikes

Thanks to our initial success with these two bikes and the continued support of our customer base we’re going to continue to innovate in this field through the end of 2016 and into 2017 as we roll out a line-up of adventure-oriented accessories and innovative charging solutions that we hope will continue to put M2S Bikes at the forefront of what is possible in the electric bike industry. Stay tuned…we’ve only just begun.

story:
The Miller electric bicycle by Enki Cycles is setting the global standard for e-bikes. Legal everywhere electric bikes are including The UK, Europe, Australia and the USA, it will redefine the way you commute with all of the fun and none of the sweat.

 

 

Miller is for the traffic haters. The lycra disdainers. The freedom lovers. The people who don’t want to start their day pushed into someone else’s arm pit. For anyone who likes to go anywhere, without any sweat. If you know how to ride a bike, Miller is for you.

 

 

 

 

This is the mid drive everyone's been waiting for. With the Bafang M500 motor that delivers 26% more torque than the Bosch mid drive, plus hydraulic disc brakes, premium Gates CDX carbon belt drive and a Samsung battery hidden in the downtube, all wrapped up in a smooth welded, hand polished frame. It's more than just an ebike with premium components at half the price, it's downright beautiful.

 

*Prototype pictured. Production model may differ slightly.

 

 

POWERFUL - The Bafang M500 delivers 95Nm of torque and weighs only 3.3kg - this is 26% more torque and 17% lighter than the Bosch Performance Line mid drive. 

SILENT - The Gates CDX Carbon Belt drive is Gates' premium offering and comes with a 30000km warranty.

SLEEK - Miller's Premium Samsung battery is hidden within the frame, ensuring protection all year round.

SELF ASSURED - Hydraulic disc brakes with internally routed cabling ensure you stop on a dime.

CONFIDENT - With a range of 70KM / 44MI, you can move confidently wherever you need to go, with all of the fun and none of the sweat.

FEATHER-LIGHT - At just 15.5KG / 34.2LBS, Miller is both ridden and carried easily wherever you need.

 

 

 

 

Simply  put, you won't find another electric bike on the market that is as sleek, or has the same quality components and workmanship as Miller, even if you pay double the price.

 

 

 

 

After our successful Kickstarter campaign we were invited by Indiegogo to take part in their InDemand program for greater exposure of our project. We had always planned to produce far more Miller ebikes than we would expect to sell on any crowdfunding platform, but allowing people to take part in our pre-order would mean they could reserve a bike in advance and receive a generous discount, and we could increase our numbers and subsequent buying power with suppliers. This buying power would mean a chance to upgrade components - a true win-win for all.

 

 

 

Motor: Bafang M500 or Bafang M600

Battery: Samsung 7AH Li-ion 18650 cells

Voltage System: 36V

PAS: 5 power levels

SENSORS: Torque + Cadence

Range: 70KM / 44MI*

Speed Limit: 25KM/H

Brakes: Hydraulic disc front and rear

Drive: Gates Carbon CDX Belt Drive with either Single Speed or 3 Speed IGH options

Display: Bafang

Frame: Aircraft aluminum 6061

Saddle: Selle Royal

Pedals: Wellgo

Tires: WTB 700 x 37C Riddler TCS Light / Fast Rolling

Weight: 15.5kg / 34.2lbs

Handlebar max height: 98cm

Width: 58cm

Ground Clearance: 19cm

Package includes: Miller ebike + battery + battery charger

*Range tests performed on various urban street circuits ranging from 5km to 32km, PAS 3, 68kg rider weight, standard Miller M500 config., various weather conditions - to simulate real world scenarios.

 

 

 

We are a global team who design, manufacture and deliver electric bikes the world over. With headquarters in California, USA, we are currently establishing international offices in Italy, Spain, The UK, The Netherlands,  Belgium, Germany and Australia.

 

Our mission is change the way people move and bring the joy back to riding.

 

NOTE: You will be responsible for any taxes and duties relating to the shipment of this product from our warehouse to your address.

 

 

 

PRODUCTION CAPACITY
Our factory has the capacity to produce more than 6000 bikes per month. We are capping this campaign to a maximum of 2000 bikes to minimize all risks of overload.

 

DELIVERY DELAYS
With our Billy ebike, we were one of the only Kickstarter e-bike manufacturers to ever deliver on time. This is not our first rodeo. We produce bikes all year round and understand the potential roadblocks to a timely delivery. To play it extra safe, we've factored in a HUGE time buffer to allow for any conceivable delay in ordering, production, shipping, customs clearing and domestic transport. We are determined to uphold our reputation for delivering on time in this campaign.

 

 

 

Like our Miller electric bike, would love to support us, but aren't in a position to buy a bike? Doesn't matter - there are many ways you can help.

1. Share our Indiegogo campaign page with your friends, family and social networks. Post to Twitter/Facebook/Insta or send a buddy an email or even text message.

2. Head over to our website and subscribe to our Inside Track newsletter: https://enkicycles.com

story_txt:
The Miller electric bicycle by Enki Cycles is setting the global standard for e-bikes. Legal everywhere electric bikes are including The UK, Europe, Australia and the USA, it will redefine the way you commute with all of the fun and none of the sweat.
 



 
Miller is for the traffic haters. The lycra disdainers. The freedom lovers. The people who don’t want to start their day pushed into someone else’s arm pit. For anyone who likes to go anywhere, without any sweat. If you know how to ride a bike, Miller is for you.
 

 
 

 
This is the mid drive everyone's been waiting for. With the Bafang M500 motor that delivers 26% more torque than the Bosch mid drive, plus hydraulic disc brakes, premium Gates CDX carbon belt drive and a Samsung battery hidden in the downtube, all wrapped up in a smooth welded, hand polished frame. It's more than just an ebike with premium components at half the price, it's downright beautiful.
 

*Prototype pictured. Production model may differ slightly.
 

 
POWERFUL - The Bafang M500 delivers 95Nm of torque and weighs only 3.3kg - this is 26% more torque and 17% lighter than the Bosch Performance Line mid drive. 
SILENT - The Gates CDX Carbon Belt drive is Gates' premium offering and comes with a 30000km warranty.
SLEEK - Miller's Premium Samsung battery is hidden within the frame, ensuring protection all year round.
SELF ASSURED - Hydraulic disc brakes with internally routed cabling ensure you stop on a dime.
CONFIDENT - With a range of 70KM / 44MI, you can move confidently wherever you need to go, with all of the fun and none of the sweat.
FEATHER-LIGHT - At just 15.5KG / 34.2LBS, Miller is both ridden and carried easily wherever you need.
 

 

 

 
Simply  put, you won't find another electric bike on the market that is as sleek, or has the same quality components and workmanship as Miller, even if you pay double the price.
 

 
 

 
After our successful Kickstarter campaign we were invited by Indiegogo to take part in their InDemand program for greater exposure of our project. We had always planned to produce far more Miller ebikes than we would expect to sell on any crowdfunding platform, but allowing people to take part in our pre-order would mean they could reserve a bike in advance and receive a generous discount, and we could increase our numbers and subsequent buying power with suppliers. This buying power would mean a chance to upgrade components - a true win-win for all.
 

 

 
Motor: Bafang M500 or Bafang M600
Battery: Samsung 7AH Li-ion 18650 cells
Voltage System: 36V
PAS: 5 power levels
SENSORS: Torque + Cadence
Range: 70KM / 44MI*
Speed Limit: 25KM/H
Brakes: Hydraulic disc front and rear
Drive: Gates Carbon CDX Belt Drive with either Single Speed or 3 Speed IGH options
Display: Bafang
Frame: Aircraft aluminum 6061
Saddle: Selle Royal
Pedals: Wellgo
Tires: WTB 700 x 37C Riddler TCS Light / Fast Rolling
Weight: 15.5kg / 34.2lbs
Handlebar max height: 98cm
Width: 58cm
Ground Clearance: 19cm
Package includes: Miller ebike + battery + battery charger
*Range tests performed on various urban street circuits ranging from 5km to 32km, PAS 3, 68kg rider weight, standard Miller M500 config., various weather conditions - to simulate real world scenarios.
 
 

 
We are a global team who design, manufacture and deliver electric bikes the world over. With headquarters in California, USA, we are currently establishing international offices in Italy, Spain, The UK, The Netherlands,  Belgium, Germany and Australia.
 
Our mission is change the way people move and bring the joy back to riding.
 

NOTE: You will be responsible for any taxes and duties relating to the shipment of this product from our warehouse to your address.
 
 

 
PRODUCTION CAPACITYOur factory has the capacity to produce more than 6000 bikes per month. We are capping this campaign to a maximum of 2000 bikes to minimize all risks of overload.
 
DELIVERY DELAYSWith our Billy ebike, we were one of the only Kickstarter e-bike manufacturers to ever deliver on time. This is not our first rodeo. We produce bikes all year round and understand the potential roadblocks to a timely delivery. To play it extra safe, we've factored in a HUGE time buffer to allow for any conceivable delay in ordering, production, shipping, customs clearing and domestic transport. We are determined to uphold our reputation for delivering on time in this campaign.
 
 

 
Like our Miller electric bike, would love to support us, but aren't in a position to buy a bike? Doesn't matter - there are many ways you can help.

All of your support counts and we appreciate anything you can do.

story:
Give Luke 5! 

This is my friend, Denise.  She is a music therapist (and musician), craft making Mom and all around wonderful lady.

With her is her 11 year old son, Lucas who has autism.  For the past few years they have been riding a tandem bike together but Luke has grown quite tall and after a big spill last summer the bicycle built for two has been retired.  Unfortunately, Lucas' challenges make it difficult for him to ride a traditional bicycle.  During the family bike rides Denise notes that he smiles, engages with the family and joins in sing alongs.  The bike rides give him much needed fresh air exercise, social interaction and community building opportunities.

In a recent contest to win a trike style bike Luke made a good showing.  Unfortunately, there were many worthy contestants and he didn't have the numbers needed.

After watching the process unfold, I started thinking;  What if everyone who voted for Luke (in the end he had 289 votes) was willing to give him $5.00 toward the purchase of the bike.   The bike costs more than a traditional bicycle, about $500.00 but with a lot of us willing to do a little we can have that bike to him in no time!

So, with Luke in mind I ask you to forgo that coffee, make one less trip to the drive through, dig in the couch cushions.  You know you have $5.00 worth of change your car, on the dresser or in the bottom of your purse! Please join me in making a small sacrifice so a kid can have a great summer for years to come!

 

P.S. Of course more than $5.00 is accepted and appreciated!

story:
To all the amazing supporters out there, we have reached a point where the private sector of small businesses needs to start pitching in where the government is failing. It may not be the most profitable decision, but the bigger picture is helping the smaller communities thrive.. benefits everyone in the long run.

My name is Matt Houser and my mission is to raise enough money to duplicate the work transportation program I created in Michigan and expand it in South Carolina. The concept is simple, we help people with transportation issues get back into the work force and hopefully stop using the excuse that they can’t get a job because they don't have a car.

 I am trying to raise $10,000 toward the purchase (or donation) of 2 vehicles for the launch of a new work Fresh Start Work Transportation Program.

Here is a little background on the concept. I started this project just over 4 years ago with one vehicle and a burning desire to create a program that was beneficial to my community.

When I moved to Michigan, I quickly realized just how bad private transportation was needed. I did my research and found that there was a 50 mile gap between Kalamazoo and Grand Rapids with no taxis or city transportation anywhere in between.  After doing more research, I found that the biggest obstacle in finding gainful employment for people in those areas was establishing reliable transportation. It seemed like everyone I met had the same reason for not working!! They can’t get a car because they don't have a job, and they don't have a job because they can’t afford a car. The temp agencies and the government programs in the surrounding areas also have trouble placing people in jobs because the transportation issues.

 So I decided that I would make it my mission to focus on helping these communities get to and from work with reliable and affordable transportation. The first thing I did was reach out to the local temp agencies to see how I could be of service to them. Then I wrote a proposal for Michigan Works (Job Placement Program) to see if they could benefit from my services and business really took off from there. My first year with the program was busier than I ever expected.  So busy in fact that I had to purchase additional vehicles to help support the local market that was calling on my services.

Now that I have established a working model in Michigan, I would like to start helping other smaller communities that struggle with the same issues, however, raising capital for the vehicles is one of the biggest obstacles I face being a for profit business, along with my personal line of credit being maxed out with 3 open vehicle loans.

 Once the program is up and running it has proven to be self-sustaining and a big asset to the community. It can change the lives of the people who use the services by putting cash back in their hands to support their families and their communities.

Here is the breakdown of expenses. I will be covering all expenses that exceed the 10k I’m trying to raise.

2 vehicles @$5,000 each

Tax title registration $250 each

Licensing, inspections and regulatory fees $200 each vehicle.

The commercial insurance states that I have to have "mandatory 1 million of liability", which will cost $2950 per year per vehicle.

Advertisement is minimal as I will be personally sitting down with the local agencies to establish accounts and then they would pass the information to their clients. Minimal print and internet ads will cost $500 per 6 months.

In the event that we don’t raise enough money to launch 2 vehicles, I will start with just one and work from there. Thank you for taking the time to look at my proposal! I hope one year from now you will see more people in other communities taking advantage of these services as we hope to expand with the demand of more transportation needs.

story:
Hello,

I gave you the hard research and all the fundamental information you could ever want about the need for handicap accessible transportation in my initial appeal for this campaign. Now, I want to share with you the real raw reasons why this service is so important.

I ask you to take a moment and go over your activities over just this week alone in your head. Now think about how many times you jumped in your vehicle and ran to the market or convenience store because you had a craving for something and you just had to have it. How many times did you run out to meet up with a friend for coffee or drinks? Did you have to run out and grab a carton of half & half for your morning coffee that you forgot to pick up yesterday? Did you get frustrated because you had to run errands after you went grocery shopping and you kept thinking about how your ice cream was melting away, minute by excruciating minute you could almost hear it drip, drip, drip, drip, while the fool in the hot rod in front of you was poking along at a snails pace? How about running to your doctors office on a long lunch break to address that pesky ear ache you have had for the last week?

Now imagine making an appointment "no more than 5 days in advance" (this is an actual rule from a large transportation provider in my area and is a direct result of the influx of people with disabilities in the system after the closing of HGA) for a ride on one of the wheelchair/handicap vans that are run by a very large for profit transportation provider in your area to go grocery shopping. Imagine sitting on a van that drove around picking up passenger after passenger and dropping them off at locations that were geographically closer than your destination. Yep, you made an "appointment" to have transportation to the grocery store, but that only means that the behemoth transportation provider is going to pick you up right around the time that you asked for. That doesn't mean that you will get to your destination at that time. You arrive at the grocery store and your trip was a little longer than you expected, now you only have 45 minutes to get all your groceries and meet the handicap van at the entrance because you have to book a return trip in advance also, they don't wait and then you pile all your groceries in, and keep them safe from the foot traffic that will be getting on & off the van. You start praying that today is a slow day and you get home within an hour or so with your groceries intact. Not today, everybody within a 10 mile radius of you needed to go out today too.

Now can you hear it, drip, drip, drip??

Think about this for a minute. Everyday you go to work and the people you work with are close friends. You swap stories, share your lunch break, maybe you talk about your kids and show pictures of them to as many people as will look at them . You grab a bite to eat and a cocktail after work. You plan a weekend to go shopping and catch a movie. These are things that happen in peoples lives everyday. Then, one day you are told that your work is closing on Monday. You have no job, no place to go and now you will lose all the friends you have made in your co-workers. They will all be going to other companies all over the state. You even have to move in order to continue to have a place to lay your head. Now after you find a new job you now have to make new friends and hope that this place is as nice as the last one, that the people treat you kindly and you make new friends and your contribution is valued.

This is what happened recently in Western Massachusetts. Holyoke Geriatrics closed their doors due to "mismanagement" of money. We know what that means don't we? One dollar for you and two for me. 80 people that called the adult day healthcare program also known as adult daycare their "work" or their home away from home lost the only place they had to lead a relatively "normal" or similar life to that of an able bodied person.

Not to mention the residential services it provided also known as a nursing home. So many people moved to other facilities near AND far. New streets to learn, new bus routes, new doctors, new stores, new day programs, new senior centers.

The one constant in all these scenarios is that people that are physically handicapped and/or developmentally impaired need consistent, reliable, and individually tailored transportation.

I ask that you please help me provide that. Please help our friends, families, neighbors and community members live their lives too. Please donate to this campaign so that I, with the help of my community can make these peoples lives a little easier. These people suffer enough, let's do what we can to help. 


Thank you for taking the time to read this. Please donate to this start up non-profit endeavor and plesae share.

We can't do this without you.

Warm regards,

Deana

story:
Hello.

We are Texas Guadaloop, a team of students and researchers from the University of Texas at Austin, who are building the first working Hyperloop transportation vehicle using air bearing technology.

What's the Hyperloop?

In 2013, Elon Musk released a white paper discussing a new mode of transportation called the Hyperloop that would transport people and cargo from major city to major city in 20-30 minutes. By levitating a pod on a bed of air and propelling it through a partially evacuated tube, speeds of up to 700mph can be reached. It's as fast as a plane, but still as convenient to ride as a train.

This is crazy. Could this really work?

There is no doubt a Hyperloop will be built. Hyperloop One conducted their first full-scale test in vacuum a year ago, and several other Hyperloop companies have raised millions to build transport systems in South Korea, Dubai, and Europe.

In 2015, SpaceX announced an international competition for student teams to design and build a working prototype pod to compete on a one-mile test track that SpaceX has built at their HQ in Hawthorne. The first few teams hit the track in January, and Texas Guadaloop was one of 22 teams left competing on the track last August. This year we're coming for more. We're preparing yet another pod to go compete this July. Our team has worked tirelessly these past three years to create a cost-effective and energy-efficient solution to make the Hyperloop a reality.

Air Bearings.

Elon's original idea for the Hyperloop was to use air-bearings to levitate in a frictionless environment. Imagine an air hockey table, but where air comes out of the puck instead of the table. Since the SpaceX-Hyperloop competition was announced, there has been no team or company to test the viability of air bearings at high speeds.

We are one of the first teams in the world who are building an air bearing pod and are preparing to test it at high velocities on the SpaceX-Hyperloop test track. The implications for transportation fueled off of air are groundbreaking and have the power to disrupt the transportation industry. 

Why not MagLev?

MagLev utilizes magnets to levitate the pod whereas air-bearings utilize pressurized air. MagLev is a proven technology and has no doubt been tested thoroughly,  but the advantages of utilizing air-bearings are enormous. Air-bearings do not need to hit a specific speed to levitate and they do not exhibit drag. This means we could use air bearings for shorter distances and destinations without costly expenditures of MagLev. There is a reason why MagLev trains haven't popped up in America. Imagine putting them in a more expensive vacuum tube.

Will the Hyperloop really become the world's next major mode of transportation?

The prototype we are building for the Hyperloop can support thousands of pounds at a fraction of cost and energy. Building a full-scale system has the potential to make goods and supplies flow more efficiently than current methods. Additional highways and cars won't solve traffic problems, but a Hyperloop can let you work in one city and live in another. Texas Guadaloop wants to be the team to bring Hyperloop to Texas. 

Long-term vision

The Texas triangle contains the largest number of super commuters in the U.S. Our dream is to build the Hyperloop in Texas, connecting major growth cities such as Austin, Dallas, and Houston.

Will you join us and make this happen? 

After presenting in front of SpaceX engineers at Design Weekend in January 2016, our team was not selected to build a pod for Competition Weekend I last January. But we had full faith in our design, and decided to build a pod anyways. Fast forward a year later, and SpaceX chose us to compete at Competition Weekend II in August 2017. Move one more year ahead and we're coming back to the competition at full throttle with our best version of the Pod so far. We're a team of graduate and undergraduate students and researchers with a never quit attitude, and we are going to scrap our way to the finish line no matter what. Will you help us get there?

The prototype we are building for the Hyperloop can support thousands of pounds at a fraction of cost and energy. Building a full-scale system has the potential to make goods and supplies flow more efficiently than current methods. Additional highways and cars won't solve traffic problems, but a Hyperloop can let you work in one city and live in another. Texas Guadaloop wants to be the team to bring Hyperloop to Texas. 

Long-term vision
The Texas triangle contains the largest number of super commuters in the U.S. Our dream is to build the Hyperloop in Texas, connecting major growth cities such as Austin, Dallas, and Houston.
Will you join us and make this happen? 
After presenting in front of SpaceX engineers at Design Weekend in January 2016, our team was not selected to build a pod for Competition Weekend I last January. But we had full faith in our design, and decided to build a pod anyways. Fast forward a year later, and SpaceX chose us to compete at Competition Weekend II in August 2017. Move one more year ahead and we're coming back to the competition at full throttle with our best version of the Pod so far. We're a team of graduate and undergraduate students and researchers with a never quit attitude, and we are going to scrap our way to the finish line no matter what. Will you help us get there?

story:
Go faster with the Chameleon Turbo ebike!

The Chameleon scooter by Daymak is the SMARTEST, safest electric bicycle that is adaptable to everyone's unique needs. 

Ebikes can be ridden on the roads without insurance or a license if they feature a 500W motor (in some states 750W) and they have pedals. Most ebikes and scooters that fit into this category are either too weak, have very few features, or are extremely expensive.

That's what makes Chameleon the best ebike on the market. We've succeeded in building a fully loaded scooter with great features at an affordable price, all while reducing CO2 emissions!

After over 13 years of selling ebikes we've come up with features that will satisfy everyone's safety, speed, range, torque, and customization needs.

We achieved these goals through:

+Bluetooth controller 

+84V battery pack 

+Smart Solar  case with integrated +RGB LED lights

Let's look at these features in detail.


It is possible for the Chameleon to reach speeds of  60km/h  (37 mph.) It is the responsibility of the rider to set the speed  based on local laws.

BLUETOOTH CONTROLLER

The Daymak Drive Bluetooth controller with My Ebike App: Our software can run on Android OS. Let's face - it we're not all the same. We ride in different places, and everyone is not the same weight. Our controller lets the user define what they need to accommodate variations in height, weight, and road incline. The rider can adjust torque (for climbing steep inclines), speed, and select eco mode (for longer range). Riders can also  lock the motor (for anti-theft control), turbo on for maximum torque power, off road mode to on trails and dirt roads  and we are working on a few more functions that we are now finalizing during this campaign.

No Smartphone? No Problem?

 If you don't have a smartphone, you can still do customize your ebike to fit your needs. When you order your Chameleon Turbo we will ask you a few questions so that we can set the default settings to what may fit you best. However if you need to make tweaks once you receive it, you can adjust any of the settings by connecting it to a computer. Other than that, you scooter runs perfectly without it! 








Chameleon Scooter: 84V BATTERY PACK

The average battery pack for an electric bicycle is 48V. Some have 60V, and a few have 72V. But we've put in an 84V battery pack. Why? To give you the possibility to increase torque and speed when necessary, and to give you longer range when the controller is set to ECO mode. 




CUSTOMIZABLE RGB LED LIGHTS
The additional RGB LED light strips running from the case down the side can be modified by remote to any color the rider chooses. This creates a much more visible ebike from any angle. The enhanced visibility gives additional safety and adds unique style to the Chameleon.



SMART SOLAR CASE WITH INTEGRATED RGB LED LIGHTS

The Daymak Solar Case features 3 integrated solar panels that continuously trickle charge the battery. Trickle charging the battery extends the range of the bike by 6-9 km per day. Trickle charging also negates the possibility of a dead battery, which is the number one failure in ebikes, and the most expensive part to replace. The solar case also provides storage space for groceries, books, your lunch or whatever you desire. The case is also an added safety feature: The LED lights are integrated with the brake lights and signal lights, providing a clearer picture for the drivers behind you. (One of our stretch goals is to add sensors for the brake lights to turn on automatically when the ebike slows down, and turn on the lights automatically when it gets darker.)

The Chameleon is loaded with features including front and dual hydraulic disc brakes, front and rear lights, signals, key ignition, alarm system, digital speedometer, odometer, double kick stand, charger, foot rest board, front and rear shocks, and upgraded grips!

Each Chameleon is going be assembled in North America. All individual components including batteries, chargers, controllers and motor will be tested in detail. After completing each assembly, the ebike will be ridden to make sure it's perfect. We want to create the best scooter possible with the highest quality.


Refer as many friends as you can and when their contributions total the amounts shown below, you'll be rewarded!  With enough referrals you can even earn a FREE Wave Electric Bike! It's easy. Just spread the link and earn points!


How Does it Work?
1. Log into your Indiegogo account or click here to signup for an Indiegogo account if you have not yet already created an account. 
2. Navigate to the Chameleon campaign page and click the "link" icon 

on the left side of the campaign. Paste this link into an email to send to all your friends. Or click the Facebook, Twitter, or Google Plus icons to share your unique link on your social media accounts. 
3. View your total referral contribution amount by logging into your profile in the upper right and then click "Referrals".


Each Chameleon will be build and tested in North America before shipping to meet the best quality possible. The Chameleon Ebike come with 1 year parts warranty on the motor and frame. 6 months on every other component. Everything is covered except regular wear and tear on tires and brakes an fairing scratches. All parts are available from our website and most bicycle parts are available at specialized bike shops.


With your support, the Daymak Chameleon will become the best ebike ever. When this ebike is completed, it will retail for $2000+. For supporting us in our early efforts we are offering this ebike at a nominal price, just above cost. Each Chameleon will be built in North America and will be tested rigoursly before being shipped. You will not be disappointed! This scooter is the best I have ridden, and one of the greenest ebikes on the market, all  at an incridble price.  

Thank you in advance for supporting us.

Let's go Green!

Funding

Your support will be used to:

  • Complete the software development of the application
  • Complete the molds for the Solar LED CASE
  • Add additional software features to the app
  • Improve every detail possible

Each Ebike on the road reduces CO2

On average, a car produces about 170g CO2 per kilometer. If your car travels 2000 kilometers per month, it produces about 340 kilograms CO2 –or 4080 KG of dioxide! The average ebike if you factor the cost of electricity coming from non clean sources would equal at most  3.4 g CO2 per kilometer.  90% of ebike riders do approximately 10 km / day. If the Chameleon is charged only using the solar power of the case (approx. 9 km/day). The Chameleon consumption would be 0 grams per km! Regardless if you plug in or not the Chameleon is one of the cleanest ebikes in the market. Every time you ride it instead of public transportation or a car you are doing good for the environment !!You are doing your part!  GO GREEN!

Risks & Challenges

Successful Indiegogo campaigns sometimes have encountered problems when taking their prototype products into production. This includes finding reliable suppliers and meeting quality control standards necessary for engineering products for mass-production. Daymak has several years of experience in dealing with parts suppliers worldwide.  The Chameleon is going to be built in North America. All  suppliers have been inspected by Daymak and we've done our due diligence to ensure that the suppliers can build to Daymak's specifications. Our plans are in place, and a successfully funded project will provide the resources needed to complete and deliver the best Chameleon possible to you.

Other Ways You Can Help

We think we made this ebike extremely affordable. Still expensive? Help us spread the word through Indiegogo and you can earn a free ebike with the referral program. All you have to do is spread the word! Let's go Green!

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I test ride it?

Yes. You can. Only at our location in Toronto. Send us an email when you want to come.  We will post videos shortly of riders.

Can the Chameleon really go off road / dirt roads?

The Chameleon can go most on dirt roads, and trails as an off road vehicle. It has 1500 lbs rated shocks and you will be surprised what it can do.

How is the bike on handling uphill terrain?

The Chameleon can climb almost anything in North America up to 39 degrees. You will not need to pedal.

What’s the maximum weight limit?
We've tested the bike up to 400 lbs. We cannot make any guarantees about performance or durability above that weight but the shocks are rated up to 1500 lbs.

Can the bike take 2 riders?
Yes. Both riders must be above 16. Check the regulations in your area.

How much does the bike weigh?

The bike weighs approximately 130 lbs without the battery.

How much does the battery weigh?
The battery weighs approximately 60 lbs (SLA version.)

What are the battery specifications?

84volt 12ah SLA battery is designed for long running time. Batteries have a lifetime of 300 charges plus. They require to be charged at least once a month and should be kept in temperatures between -5 degrees celsius and 30 degrees celsius. They can be charged at any time. You do not need to wait for the battery to be drained. 

Can I buy tires or tubes anywhere?

Absolutely. You can buy tires and tubes at most specialized bike shops.

Is this a single speed bike? Can you limit it to 10MPH for off-roading?
You can set the speed at any level you want. If you have a younger rider or older rider that you want to set at slow speeds, you can.

Is there speed monitoring/digital display on the bike? 
There is a built-in digital display giving you all the information you need; Battery life, odometer, speed.

Is there a key/interlock to prevent accidental starting? 
You can start the ebike with the key or the remote starter. The ebike will not move on its own.

Legal/Where it can and cannot be used

Can this be used in PEI / NYC?  
At this current time, there are laws and restrictions on eBikes in NYC and the State of New York and province of PEI in Canada. To be safe, please check with your local authorities as these types of regulations change frequently.

Do you have to wear a helmet?

Yes. You are required to wear a helmet. As with any bicycle, safety should be paramount. We would recommend wearing a helmet, even if your state laws do not require it. 

PAYMENT & SHIPPING

Can it be picked up ? 
Yes it can. You can pick it up from Las Vegas or Toronto. There is handling fee of $49.00. 

For people who want to pick up the unit. Just put the amount on the right side “CONTRIBUTE NOW”.

i.e. If you want the Deluxe put $699 + $49 (handling) =$ 748 USD.

And then send us an email to info@daymak.com and specify that you want to pick it up and what colour you would like or send us a direct message through Indiegogo

How do I pick the color?

When you select a perk please specify the color you want.

Will the cost of shipping go down? 
No. The current cost is $299 for US shipping for both Canada / USA. You are free to arrange using your own delivery. Only a $49.00 handling fee will be applied. Shipments will be made from Las Vegas or Toronto.

Do you ship to Europe?
Yes we do. An estimated cost of shipping to Europe will be $699 USD but may be slightly cheaper or more expensive depending on your exact location.

COST/ MANUFACTURING

Why is the price so low for the Chameleon eBike compared to competition?

Daymak is 100% committed to creating the first affordable eBike scooter.  There is no scooter like it. It has more options than anything on the road today at the lowest price point.

How can you keep the eBike’s cost so low?

This goes back to Daymak's experience. Having had years of experience in sourcing and manufacturing, we can keep cost low based on volume. 

How is the eBike built?

The Chameleon eBike is manufactured using all existing parts to keep cost low. The Chameleon will be assembled in North America for best quality control. Each ebike will be tested rigoursly by us.

Can Daymak Chameleon eBike handle the volume of bikes?

Yes. The more bikes the better. This will allow us to reduce the overall cost of the bike. Our sourcing and manufacturing partners are world class. Daymak has been working with them for several years.

SUPPORT

Will replacement parts be available at local shops/manufacturers? 

You will be able to purchase all the parts online at our partner site called www.omgextras.com Regular parts can also be purchased at most specialized bike shops or through our dealers.

Can I get a refund?

According to Indiegogo, contributions are non-refundable in their Terms of Use. There will be no refunds as all funds go immediately to
manufacturing.

Will there be a network of authorized Chameleon eBike dealers? 

We are looking for dealers worldwide. Eventually we hope to have authorized dealers across the world, but in the meantime you can check our website for dealer listings.

story:
Growing up as an only child, I've sort of always done things on my own. Just in this past year however, I've realized that I've never built anything. I started to think about it more and more, and decided that I would enhance my bike: electrically. This idea has grown and grown, to the point where the only thing missing is finances. I do odd jobs when I can find them, but being the age that I am, I'm unable to find steady work to support my dream. So I am asking you. I'm asking those of you who are interesting in pushing a young teen to achieve his goals. I'm asking you to join me in defeating this challenge. It doesn't take a lot. And every dollar, any penny helps. Who's ready to help me build this ebike? 

Kyle J. Steinke

9th grade

And every dollar, any penny helps. Who's ready to help me build this ebike? Kyle J. Steinke9th grade

story:
Why did I start this?!

Cyclists who have just had their bikes stolen, Usually are not psychologically ready to spend a lot on a new bike which is another sitting duck for the thieves. So most of the victims either stop using bicycles for a while or replace it with a used bicycle. About two year ago, I also had my bike stolen. I was not surprised, But I was mad at the thief because I had to take a bus instead of my beautiful bike. I wanted to replace my bike as soon as possible; So I went to a flea market and bought a used bike...

In a few days I realized that maybe I have contributed to bike crimes by buying a bike from strangers, how could i make sure that the bike was not stolen? Should I have interrogated the bike seller or should I have judged him based on his look???

Non of those were the solution; So I started to think to the problem and search for a solution. The results of that research sparked the idea of Cyclingboom's community.

I strongly believe that this project could make a difference and that's why I spent months of my time to develop a system for bike theft deterrence, along with lots of other features for cycling community.

Now I am here and I need your help to make it happen!

Thank you in advanced for your contribution.

What Is This Initiative About?

We don’t know the exact number of bicycle thefts, yet unofficial statistics are showing tens of millions of bike crimes/year  happening all over the world.

In Cycling Boom, we think that the solution to bike thefts is not bigger, heavier and stronger chains, locks and whatsoever...

Our conclusion is that the only way to deter bike thefts is to increase the risk of the crime and also eliminate the market for those stolen bikes.

Analyzing the crime, it is obvious that we have a flaw in our perception about it.

Its being naive to think that the bike crimes happen solely because of the existence of thieves. Its clear that most bike crimes happen because there is a market for stolen bicycles.

So For every bike crime there are at least 2 victims, the one who got a bike stolen and the one who is buying a stolen bike as a used bike.

In this pattern one gets a bike stolen, then he or she goes to a flea market or online store and buys a used-bike that is probably stolen from a another peer,  and This makes a chain and a paradigm that is infinitely repeated.We believe that cyclists wouldn’t buy stolen bikes providing that there is an easy way to distinguish them.

Our plan at Cycling Boom is providing an easy way to identify stolen bikes.  Along with a free registry system we offer a free metal bicycle tag made of engraved stainless steel for everyone  and also under-priced premium designs for those who want to support initiative. This enables us to register our bikes and makes it easier to track the status of the bikes in an online universal bicycle registry system.

By convention these tags  would be installed on the top tube or head tube, which is the most visible place on the bike.

Consequently we ask bicycle owners to enter the basic specification of the bike into our online database. It enables cyclists to report bicycle theft whenever it happens without loss of data and it also makes it possible for police and people who are looking for used bicycles to have a tool to check the status of the bikes by knowing the serial number.

We encourage everyone to check this serial number if they ever wanted to buy a second-hand bike.

 

What We Need

To Make this initiative self sustainable, we need to reduce the production costs and that is not an easy task, if we outsource engraving jobs. So we would need the production Facilities to reduce the prices and supply more and more cyclists with free and premium tags.

It is also important to redesign the alpha version of the website and be ready to expand the service for more people while maintaining the service in a high standard.

What You Get(Perks)

You have a Heart of gold!!! Most of our perks are made of steel though! Yet we Hope You would like them :)

A little Gift For all contributors

Thank you for considering Bike Theft Deterrence for Contribution...As The first treat, all the contributors would receive a free stainless steel tag and a  small Piece of bicycle inspired object such as KeyHolder, Tiny Bicycle, Cb 2012 Bracelet ...(we would not repeat writing this in perk section. It Is already included in all the perks)

Free Stainless steel Bicycle Tags For Everyone

Free Bike Inspired Objects

 

 

 Bicycle Tag (C-Series)

Bicycle tags enables you to register a bicycle in our database even if your bicycle doesn't have a frame serial #, and it also includes a reference to the website Address, so other cyclist would know how to contact the owner.

 

 Bicycle Tag (B-Series)

A Bicycle tag In form of Head badge; Ideal for sleek bicycles and chic people...

 

 Bicycle Tags (A-Series)

To Deter Theft From your Bike, Cb Tag|A-series Consists of 5 Piece of stainless steel tags to be attached on different parts of the bicycle such as fork, wheels, Saddle, etc...

 

 

 

 Bicycle Tags (Family Kit)

 

 

Other Incentives

 

Cb Earrings

 

Wheel Necklace

 

GearRing

 

Wheel Earring

 

gEarrings

 

T Shirts

Shipping quotes

Economy Mail: $3.00

 for thin  products such as tags, Necklace; Also for non-assembled products. (e.g The Earring and the ear hooks come separately in case that you choose this shipment method)

Priority Mail: $5.00

Express Mail: $10.00

Mini-Box Economy Worldwide: $10.00

(for Larger and Assembled products such as GearRings, T shirts)

MiniBox Track Worldwide: $15.00



 

The Impact Of Cyclingboom

Unfortunately, bike crimes has influenced our cycling habits in a very bad way. Many people avoid riding their bike to work as they are afraid  their beautiful bike might get stolen. Some people use cheap and rusty bicycles to avoid a big loss in case of crime, but both situations spoil our experience of riding a bike in urban environment.

In our desired future cities, no one would stop riding bicycles because of fear for rider's safety or bikes security.

We pursue to have a positive influence in the new upcoming cycling Boom age and Bike Theft Deterrence Initiative is just a part of the job we are planning to do.

We are planning other initiatives such as Peer to peer bike sharing program and the main goal is striving toward making cities as a better and safer place for the cyclists and their bicycles.

 

There Is Always A Way You Can Help

Mass adoption is so important to get the best results, so if you like this project you can join us in this tough battle against bike criminals and help by:

Spreading the word: Tell your cyclist friends about this project and let them know about signs of stolen bikes.

Organize cycling events: Handling and shipping orders requires a lot of work if done separately for every cyclist, If you could organize an event and place one order on behalf of all the group members, that would be a great help to us while the group members also save the shipping expenses.

You own a bicycle shop? Supply your costumers with free and premium tags and help us in distributing the product.

You own a bike and don’t use it frequently? You could list it in our P2P Bike sharing platform and lend it to a peer traveler cyclist for a couple of days.

story:
FUNDING ACHIEVED

Delighted to report that a private donor has helped us to achieve our funding target.

Of course we are always grateful to receive donations towards upkeep amd maintenance so please check our Facebook page to find out how to donate.

Big thanks,

Tom & The Busketeers.

————————————————————————-

WNO 481 is the 1953 Bristol KSW 5G ECW open top double-decker bus that carried Paul McCartney, family and new band Wings to 25 concerts in 25 cities across 9 countries in Europe racking up 12,072 kilometres - 7,500 miles hotly pursued by the world's press hungry for news of what John, Paul, George and Ringo were going to do next after the break up of The Beatles.

John went off and had his adventures, Paul got himself an old English open-top double-decker bus had it painted in the style of The Beatles, Woodstock, Magical Mystery Tour and set off on his first major tour without John, George and Ringo. By the time the European tour was over his new band was the real deal ready to take on the UK and then the USA. Just four short years later in 1976 what started on the bus, James Paul McCartney's 'Bond' mission with his new musical mates, culminated in him writing and performing his way back to the pinnacle of stadium rock acts. Sir Paul McCartney is a national treasure. The most successful, biggest selling singer-songwriter performer ever.

Paul McCartney gave WNO 481 its Wings. For two months in 1972 WNO 481 was the most famous bus in the world. Down the years many books, videos and articles have documented Paul McCartney, Wings and WNO 481. 48 years after that 1972 tour a recent video of the bus on its Facebook page achieved over 25,000 views. WNO 481's Facebook page has 2,928 registered Followers with many thousands of Likes, Loves, Wow's, Hugs etc. for its many posts, photos and videos. If you Google 'WNO 481' or '1972 Wings Tour Bus' you will get some idea of its very full history. It is probably still the most famous bus in the world.

WNO 481 needs restoration following years of neglect, quietly forgotten in a dusty ravine in Tenerife.

Our goal is to bring the bus back to its glorious best. Representing 67 years of classically beautiful automotive ‘transport of the people’ design heritage and approaching 50 years of rock and roll art and history on wheels.

This is how it will look when restored.

WNO 481 is a living, mobile museum on wheels patiently waiting to be restored to delight the people, the fans and future charitable fundraisers. The bus is back in the UK and restorers are ready and waiting to work extra hard to put it back on the road but we need your help. Hop on board, contribute today and become part of the legend, there are choices galore! Join us for the next chapter in the story of The 1972 Wings Tour Bus; the restoration. Ding ding! - plenty of room on top!



The history of WNO 481 can be viewed on the 1972 Wings Tour Bus website, link below:
http://www.1972wingstourbus.com 



The 1972 Wings Tour Bus page on Facebook can be viewed on the link below:
http://www.facebook.com/1972wingstourbus/


To all the Fans, Friends, Followers and Moderators of the Facebook Groups and Facebook Pages that have embraced the bus thank you for bringing these truly amazing Comments. Please keep them coming, we see them all, we love them and really appreciate them.



Send us a comment on Facebook. We'd love to hear from you.

The Busketeer Club
Some time ago we started The 1972 Wings Tour Bus Supporters Club, known as The Busketeers. In the style of Alexandre Dumas’ The Three Musketeers the motto is, “One for all and all for the bus” Everyone who supports WNO 481 through a Facebook Like, Love, Wow, Hug etc. is made an Honorary Busketeer and receives a Certificate Of Appreciation.



Donors also receive a limited edition Busketeer badge. So far badges have gone out to WNO 481 supporters in the UK, Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Spain, Germany, USA, Australia, Uruguay etc.



We have put together our appeal for donations in Lennon-McCartney song titles which we hope you will enjoy:



The Future
The bus will travel far and wide and has already received messages of goodwill and invitations to appear not only at very special events but also to spend time on loan at transport museums across the country. A list of some of these events and venues, including the Classic Motor Show at NEC in 2021, is at the bottom of the page and on the website. 2022 marks the 50th anniversary of that legendary 1972 tour and plans are being discussed to re-create the tour across Europe.

WNO 481 - The 1972 Wings Tour Bus has many more stories and adventures to live and tell and with your support we can secure the future that she deserves. We look forward to putting your donations to work and we will bring you full updates on the restoration including videos which will be available via the website, Facebook page and YouTube Channel.

UPDATE - Anonymous Donor:
We are delighted to announce that we have received a pledge of £10,000 from a private donor who insists on remaining anonymous. Though we cannot reveal the identity of the donor we are incredibly excited and thankful to receive such a generous donation but more is needed to complete the restoration and secure the future of 1972 Wings Tour Bus - WNO 481.

Donate today if you care about heritage, if you are a Beatles, Wings, Paul McCartney fan, friend or follower. This is your opportunity to contribute. In return you will help preserve for future generations the heritage of this historic iconic vehicle and at the same time become part of the rock and roll legend that is the 1972 Wings Tour Bus - WNO 481.

Perks and Items Of Interest
As a thank you we have put together some Perks and Items of interest based on level of donation and these can be viewed on the Perks page. More information is available on the web page: http://www.1972wingstourbus.com/support-wno-481...

The first 100 donors will receive a free Busketeer badge.
Thank you and we look forward to you joining us on WNO 481's forthcoming onward journeys.

Tom and The Busketeers
The 1972 Wings Tour Bus Restoration Team.

www.1972wingstourbus.com

www.facebook.com/1972wingstourbus/

About:
I have been a Beatles - John, Paul, George and Ringo fan since 1962. In 2019 I rescued the 1972 Wings Tour Bus with the intention of bringing this iconic bus back to the fans of the bus not only because it is a classically beautiful example of 1950's transport of the people design heritage but also because of its incredible well documented time with the biggest rock star on the planet, Paul McCartney, at one of the most important times of his musical life. A true rock and roll legend.

What They’re Saying:
“We would like to wish you the best of luck with the refurbishment and please do send photographs when the bus is completed” - MPL - (Sir Paul McCartney's Company)

"We only wish you the best of luck on restoring the bus and look forward to seeing its wonderful completion!" - Denny Laine

"It sounds like you're doing a beautiful thing here. I wish you well with it" - Denny Seiwell

“Wishing you every success” - Richard Curtis

"We would like to invite WNO 481 to appear at The Classic Motor Show at The NEC as soon as she is restored, 2021?" - FBHVC

“It is a great object and it will be brilliant when it’s restored” – Museum of Liverpool

"What a great piece of music history..." - National Trust

"An interesting heritage focus" - Lottery Heritage Fund

"Fantastic historical bus" - Culture Coventry

"We would love to have it at an event at Beaulieu" - Beaulieu Motor Museum

"You would certainly be very welcome at any of our events"- London Bus Museum

"What a fab project!" - Brighton Fringe

"A unique piece of transport history" - National Museums NI

"Sounds fascinating!" - Handel and Hendrix Museum

"It would be fantastic if you and the KSW could join us for the event." - Showbus

"I am sure we can assist with your quest to bring WNO 481 back to life and promote its historic journey, educate and aid in its heritage preservation so that future generations can enjoy the marvel that it is." - Emma Balaam FBHVC

“This international treasure, a living museum on wheels, is parked firmly at the intersection of timeless, chart-topping music, rock and roll, a time-capsule of art and classically beautiful automotive design heritage”…anon

“WNO 481 - Probably the most famous bus in the world.”

“The Bus That Rocked”

NOTE: If luck and generosity are on our side and we are over subscribed all proceeds will go towards the future maintenance and upkeep of the bus.

story:
About MATE.

We created MATE to get more people on the bikes. And because we thought the world needed an eBike that actually looks cool. 

MATE is not only extremely practical and packed with smart features, it’s also so much fun to ride.

MATE is a foldable electric bike that is a dream to ride. With front and rear suspension, a set of 2 disc brakes and an ultra comfortable saddle, MATE takes you from A to B in comfort and style. 

The 3-Step Folding system means you can take it with you anywhere: in a bus or train for faster commuting, the trunk of your car for longer road trips or even pack it under the stairs for easier storage.

We designed MATE with versatility in mind. Of course you can ride it as a normal bike with the 7 speed Shimano gears. But the real joy comes from the 350kw electric hub motor (MATE S).

As you cruise through your neighbourhood at up to 20 mph / 35 km/h  without even breaking a sweat, you’ll be convinced. And with up to 55 miles / 80 km on just a single charge, MATE takes you further and makes your commute a breeze.

We’ve also included an easy-access USB charger so you can keep your devices charged up as you ride.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Order now – and have your MATE delivered in JUNE (US)/JUNE (EU)

June: Japan, Malaysia, UAE, Hong Kong, Republic of Korea, Taiwan, Thailand

June: US, Canada and Mexico,

June: EU and Europe

What we need

Our goal is to make bikes the transport of choice for people across the globe. And we believe MATE can help us reach that goal - an affordable, versatile eBike that is fun to ride.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The MATE manifesto

To us, cycling is more than a hobby. It’s a way of life! It gives you speed, exercise, flexibility and freedom. We set out to create a bike that would make you want to leave the car at home and take your bike instead. A bike that is perfect for any rider and any situation - affordable, versatile and fun to ride. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The MATE story

Do you know why Copenhagen has been called the happiest city on Earth? BIKING!

Riding a bike gives you exercise, allows you to move freely and is the greenest form of transportation. But why aren’t there more people biking everyday then?

We realised that in some countries or places, biking is not as easy as “riding a bike” and there can be many obstacles along the way that prevent you to even consider bike as an option in your journeys.

We think people would be happier on a bike that could actually remove all the downsides of biking. That’s why we created MATE: to show the world how fun, convenient and rewarding riding a bike can be. So you have freedom and a constant reward of doing the right thing: for yourself, for others, for the planet.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You're in good hands

MATE is brought to you from Denmark with love by brother and sister team Christian Adel Michael and Julie Kronstrøm Carton. 

Christian Adel Michael, 29

Christian is a natural born entrepreneur with years of experience in the manufacturing industry.

With close relationships to factories across the world, he has organised the production and distribution of products within tight deadlines. Together with Julie, they run a company that distributes and sells consumer goods all over Northern Europe. Last Christmas they produced and delivered 10,000 electric hair-brushes across Scandinavia within 2 months.

MATE is the result of his long term passion for design, technology and innovative mobility solutions. After gaining success with a ladies eBike in 2014, Christian decided to reboot the project from the ground up, and so MATE was born. His experience with manufacturing, import and logistics is a vital asset for this project - making sure that you will get a great MATE. He knows how to tackle obstacles and turn challenges into opportunities.

Julie Kronstrøm Carton, 39 

Julie is a business and project development expert and quintessential problem solver. She is the driving force behind the high level of service and assistance you will receive from the MATE team. As a mother of 3 boys and avid biker, she believes the world would be a better place with more people biking daily. Her hope is that MATE can make it a reality.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q:The price is very low for an e-bike. Why is that?

A: Our dream is to make cycling accessible to everyone. We have worked long and hard to create an eBike that is not only affordable, but also made of quality components; a quality eBike that is made to last you through the years.

Q: How can you ensure such a low price?

A: We have extensive experience in sourcing and manufacturing products and components. This is a key factor that enables us to maintain a low units cost based on volume. With increased sales and production volume, we are confident that we can ensure a low price, even after the campaign has ended.

Q: How is MATE manufactured?

A: We have spent lots of time finding the right suppliers and manufacturers for MATE. Our many years experience dealing directly with sourcing companies, factories and shipping companies have helped us a great deal to be able to offer high quality product for the lowest price possible.

Crowdfunding helps us to keep the costs down as we can work together with the factory to produce the right amount of units, without dealing with high storage costs and other related costs.

Q: Can i order MATE S even though I do not live in US? 
We deliver MATE S anywhere in the world as long as local laws permits us to import Mate

NB: It is not legal to drive MATE S on public roads in the EU. You are allowed to own it and drive it on private property.

NB: We have not obtained an import permit for MATE S in Australia. We advise Australian backers to get a MATE City + with a booster upgrade to get a more battery power. 

Q: How much weight can MATE handle? 

A: MATE is build strong and can handle riders up to 125 kg with ease. 

Q: Doest MATE come in different sizes? 

A: MATE is designed to fit all Meaning that the seat height and front handle can be adjusted according to your needs. So whether you are 150 cm / 4'9'' or over 200 cm / 6'5'' high, you will ride comfortably at your own style.

Q: I can't see the battery - where is it? 

A: Batteries are not something you should be spending your time looking at - so it is well hidden in within the middle frame, protected by a locking mechanism.  

Q: How much does MATE weight?

A: MATE City weighs approximately 19 kg (42 lbs) without the battery and 21,5 kgs with the battery. MATE City+ weighs approximately 19 kg (42 lbs) without the battery and 22,5 kgs with the battery. MATE S weighs approximately 20,2 kg (44 lbs) without the battery and 23,7 kgs with the battery. But it's carrying handle in the middle of the frame makes it easy to lift.

Q: How long does the MATE battery last?

A: The battery inside MATE City is built to last on average up to 50 km (30 mi) with the pedal assist. With the upgraded battery found in MATE City+ and MATE S, you can get up to 80 km (55 mi). The battery takes around 5-6 hours charge or 2-4 hours with the added speed charger perk.  

Q: Can I still bike on MATE if the battery runs out of power?

A: Of course! If you run out of power, you can cycle as you would do with a regular bicycle. Even without an engine - it still feels like a dream to ride.

Q: Can I charge the battery by pedalling?

A: At the moment, MATE primarily gets its power from the charger that is provided with the bike upon purchase. However, this is a feature we are currently looking into. 

Q: Can the battery be removed?

A: Yes. The battery is designed in such a way that you can change it or replace with 2 easy steps that takes less than a minute. Simply fold the middle frame, pull out the battery and you’re done. 

Q: How is MATE delivered and is it easy to assemble?

A: MATE comes delivered with instructions in safely packed box and requires minimal assembly. You can also find help on our extensive helpdesk

However, if you don't have much experience with bikes, we recommend that you visit your local bike shop to get all parts tightened and thoroughly checked.  

Q: How much does shipping cost?

A: Shipping is set to $200 to $300 USD (depending on your destination) due to the fact that we ship worldwide directly from our assembly in China. It is also one of the reasons MATEs price is so low, as there are no intermediary between you and the factory #MATEaffordable.

Q: I live in Denmark, can I pick it up myself? 

No. MATE eBike is ordered in bulk and will be shipping to individuals directly from our assembly in China, and to a regional commercial warehouse that is not setup for walk-in or local pickup.
All MATEs will be shipped via ground shipping to the address on file. 

Q: What kind of warranty do you offer?  

A: All MATE bikes and batteries come with a 2 year manufacturer's warranty. Should you encounter some production related default in that timeframe, we will simply contact our customer support and we will take care of it. As many elements of a bike may get damaged due to normal cycling use, we do not offer warranty on parts such as tires, disc brakes, chain etc.

Q: What is your returns-policy?
This is the "MATE-promise": We are so confident that you will love your new MATE so much, that we offer you a 14 days money back guarantee after you have received it, if you are not satisfied. 
However, if you decide to do so, your MATE bike must be in new and re-sellable condition. #MATEpromise

Q: What kind of accessories do you currently have or can I expect in the near future?

A: We currently offer an more powerful battery as upgrade for MATE City+ and MATE S only, or as spare battery , but are regularly working to develop more accessories and modifications. Stay tuned for more information. Feel free to let us know what kind of accessories you’d be most interested in seeing.

Q: What about spare parts? Can any bike shop assist me?

A: The MATE battery is custom built for our frame and spare batteries will be able to buy from us. The rest of the components are fairly standard, meaning that you can upgrade/customise your bike as you desire with other parts either from us or your local bike shop. 

Q: Is it really true I can get up to 100 miles on a single charge with "BOOSTER"? 
In perfect conditions and in ECO+ mode = Assist level 1 this can be done - but in general milage is depending on power-assist setting, terrain, total bike/rider weight and weather conditions. 
On "BOOSTER" battery, you can get anywhere between 20-100 miles, depending on your riding style. For maximum range, please use the pedals when in steep situations and when accelerating. 
**All MILES/KILOMETERS listed on Indiegogo are "UP TO" and not guaranteed.**

Q: Do I need a licence to ride MATE?

A: No. Our bikes are made 100% street legal. We offer two distinctive versions of MATE: MATE City / City+, with a 250W motor which is legal in the EU, and MATE S, with a 350W motor for the US.

MATE City and MATE City+, with its 250W motor, is by default limited according to EN15194 to the top speed of 25 km/h (15,5 mph). This means that the motor will only help you up to 25km/h. MATE S, with its 350W motor, is limited to 20 mph (32 km/h), which is the legal limit in US. It will be possible to change these settings with some reprogramming which we will make available after the campaign through MATE.community.  

Q: Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT/GST?

A: The backer is responsible, please check your country's import duties/VAT/GST before purchasing. It is 0% in the US and varies internationally. You can check this comprehensive list to get started.

In the EU/EUROPE import duty and VAT will be collected via our database

In Australia import duty and GST will be collected via our database

All new orders made via Indiegogo are transferred to our database after 11 days (which is the refund window Indiegogo offers plus 1 day)

After this time period, you will be able to log into the database and create a password using the same email address as in your Indiegogo order. In our Database you will now be asked to review your shipping details one more time, accept our terms & conditions and pay VAT/GST and import (if collected via our database) 

Q: Can I test ride a MATE bike?

A: At this stage test rides are only available in Copenhagen. Contact us by email for a test ride.

Q: Can I get a refund?

A: Please refer to IndieGoGo's policy here.
